Wolaitta Sentences: Ne keettan ne sunttatu keettaaninne Gibxxe asaa ubbaa keettan eti kumana; hegee ne aawati, woikko ne maizza aawati ha biittan uttoosappe hanno gakkanaassi mule be7ibeennaba yaagees" yaagidosona. Hegaappe guyyiyan Muusee kawuwaa sinttappe kiyidi biis.

English Sentences: And Pharaoh's servants said unto him, How long shall this man be a snare unto us? let the men go, that they may serve the LORD their God: knowest thou not yet that Egypt is destroyed?
Wolaitta Sentences: Bin kawuwaa sunttati kawuwaa, "Ha bitanee nuuyyo aude gakkanaassi pire gidanee? Eti GODAU, bantta Xoossau, goinnana mala, neeni asaa yedda; Gibxxe biittai bayidoogaa neeni ha77inne akeekikkii?" yaagidosona.

English Sentences: And Moses and Aaron were brought again unto Pharaoh: and he said unto them, Go, serve the LORD your God: but who are they that shall go?
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau, kawoi Muusanne Aaroona guyye zaarissidi, "Biite; GODAU, intte Xoossau goinnite; shin biyaageeti oonee oonee?" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And Moses said, We will go with our young and with our old, with our sons and with our daughters, with our flocks and with our herds will we go; for we must hold a feast unto the LORD.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin Muusee, "Nuuni nu guutta naatuuranne cimatuura, nu attuma naatuuranne macca naatuura, nu dorssaa wudetuuranne miizzaa wudetuura issippe baana; aissi giikko, nuuni biyoosan GODAA baalaa bonchchanau koshshees" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And he said unto them, Let the LORD be so with you, as I will let you go, and your little ones: look to it; for evil is before you.
Wolaitta Sentences: Kawoi, "Taani inttena intte naatuuranne intte maccaasaara yeddiyaabaa gidikko, GODAI inttena naaganau koshshees. SHin be7ite; intte intte wozanan iitabaa halchchidoogee qoncciyan erettees.

English Sentences: Not so: go now ye that are men, and serve the LORD; for that ye did desire. And they were driven out from Pharaoh's presence.
Wolaitta Sentences: CHii, intte, Yedda giiddi gam77idoogee attumaasaa gidiyo gishshau, attumaasa xalaalai biite; biidi GODAAYYO goinnite" yaagiis. Hegaappe guyyiyan Muusanne Aaroona kawuwaa sinttappe yedettidi kessidosona.

English Sentences: And the LORD said unto Moses, Stretch out thine hand over the land of Egypt for the locusts, that they may come up upon the land of Egypt, and eat every herb of the land, even all that the hail hath left.
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAI Muusa, "Boolee Gibxxe biittan gau7anaadan, shachchaappe attidi gaden dicciyaabaa ubbaa lim77i oottana mala, ne kushiyaa Gibxxe biittaa bollan micca" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And Moses stretched forth his rod over the land of Egypt, and the LORD brought an east wind upon the land all that day, and all that night; and when it was morning, the east wind brought the locusts.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin Muusee ba gatimaa Gibxxe biittaa bollan miccin, GODAI arshsho bagga carkkuwaa he gallassa ubbaanne he qamma ubbaa he biittaa bollan carkkissiis; wonttin he carkkoi booliyaa ehiis.

English Sentences: And the locusts went up over all the land of Egypt, and rested in all the coasts of Egypt: very grievous were they; before them there were no such locusts as they, neither after them shall be such.
Wolaitta Sentences: Boolee Gibxxe biitta ubbaa bolli woraajjidi, biitta ubbasan gau7idi uttiis. Hagaa keena boole boshi he biittan hagaappe kasenne hanibeenna; woikko hagaappe sinttaunne zaarettidi hanenna.

English Sentences: For they covered the face of the whole earth, so that the land was darkened; and they did eat every herb of the land, and all the fruit of the trees which the hail had left: and there remained not any green thing in the trees, or in the herbs of the field, through all the land of Egypt.
Wolaitta Sentences: Biittai karexxana gakkanau boolee biitta ubbaa kammiis. He boolee shachchaappe attidi gaden dicciyaabaa ubbaanne mitta bollan de7iya aife ubbaa lim77i oottiis. Yaatin mittaa bollan irxxa haitti, woikko gaden ataakilttee Gibxxe biitta ubban aibinne attibeenna.

English Sentences: Then Pharaoh called for Moses and Aaron in haste; and he said, I have sinned against the LORD your God, and against you.
Wolaitta Sentences: Kawoi Muusanne Aaroona eesuwan xeesissidi, "GODAA intte Xoossaanne inttena taani naaqqaas;

English Sentences: Now therefore forgive, I pray thee, my sin only this once, and intreat the LORD your God, that he may take away from me this death only.
Wolaitta Sentences: simmi intte taayyo ta nagaraa ha issito xalaalaayyo atto giite; ha woriya boshaa taappe diggana mala, GODAA intte Xoossaa woossite" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And he went out from Pharaoh, and intreated the LORD.
Wolaitta Sentences: Muusee kawuwaa matappe kiyidi, GODAA woossiis.

English Sentences: And the LORD turned a mighty strong west wind, which took away the locusts, and cast them into the Red sea; there remained not one locust in all the coasts of Egypt.
Wolaitta Sentences: Woossin GODAI he carkkuwaa arggo bagga wolqqaama carkkuwau laammiis; laammin booliyaa tookki ekki efiidi, Zo7o Abban yeggiis. Gibxxe biitta ubban issi booleenne attibeenna.

English Sentences: But the LORD hardened Pharaoh's heart, so that he would not let the children of Israel go.
Wolaitta Sentences: Gidikkonne, GODAI kawuwaa wozanaa dammissido gishshau, Israa7eelata yeddennan ixxiis.

English Sentences: And the LORD said unto Moses, Stretch out thine hand toward heaven, that there may be darkness over the land of Egypt, even darkness which may be felt.
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAI Muusa, "Gibxxe biittan asi bochchi be7anau danddayiyo keena xumai xumana mala, ne kushiyaa saluwaa dentta" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And Moses stretched forth his hand toward heaven; and there was a thick darkness in all the land of Egypt three days:
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin Muusee ba kushiyaa saluwaa denttiis; Gibxxe biitta ubban heezzu gallassa kumettaa sakkana xumai xumiis.

English Sentences: They saw not one another, neither rose any from his place for three days: but all the children of Israel had light in their dwellings.
Wolaitta Sentences: He heezzu gallassatun asi ooninne issoi issuwaa be7ennan, woikko ba sohuwaappe denddidi beennan takkiis. SHin Israa7eelati de7iyoosan ubban etau poo7oi de7ees.

English Sentences: And Pharaoh called unto Moses, and said, Go ye, serve the LORD; only let your flocks and your herds be stayed: let your little ones also go with you.
Wolaitta Sentences: Kawoi Muusa xeesissidi, "Biite; biidi GODAAYYO goinnite; intte maccaasaikka intte naatikka inttenaara baanau danddayoosona. Intte dorssaa wudiyaanne intte miizzaa wudiyaa xalaalaa yeggidi biite" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And Moses said, Thou must give us also sacrifices and burnt offerings, that we may sacrifice unto the LORD our God.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin Muusee a, "Nuuni yarshshuwaanne xuuggidi yarshshiyo yarshshuwaa GODAASSI, nu Xoossaassi, shiishshanau, mehiyaa nuuyyo immada yeddanau koshshees.

English Sentences: Our cattle also shall go with us; there shall not an hoof be left behind; for thereof must we take to serve the LORD our God; and we know not with what we must serve the LORD, until we come thither.
Wolaitta Sentences: Nu mehee ubbaikka nunaara baanau koshshees; qinccafile issoinne guyye attenna. GODAASSI, nu Xoossaassi, goinniyo goinuwaassi he mehiyaappe dooridi ekkanau koshshees; nuuni yaa gakkennan de7iiddi, mehiyaappe augaa augaa yarshshanaakko eranau danddayokko" yaagiis.

English Sentences: But the LORD hardened Pharaoh's heart, and he would not let them go.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin GODAI kawuwaa wozanaa dammissiis; dammissin i eta yeddanau koyibeenna.

English Sentences: And Pharaoh said unto him, Get thee from me, take heed to thyself, see my face no more; for in that day thou seest my face thou shalt die.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan kawoi Muusa, "Kichcha ta achchappe! Naa77antto ta sinttan lem77i gaada nena era! Neeni ta aifiyaa ta som77uwaa be7ido gallassaikka neeyyo haiqo" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And Moses said, Thou hast spoken well, I will see thy face again no more.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin Muusee a, "Tumakka; neeni giidoogaadan taani nena naa77antto mulekka be7ikke" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And the LORD said unto Moses, Yet will I bring one plague more upon Pharaoh, and upon Egypt; afterwards he will let you go hence: when he shall let you go, he shall surely thrust you out hence altogether.
Wolaitta Sentences: Muusessi GODAI, "Taani Gibxxe kawuwaa bollinne a asaa bolli issi hara bosha yeddana; hegaappe guyyiyan i inttena ha biittaappe kessi yeddana; kessiiddi i inttena issoinne attennan ubbaakka yedettana.

English Sentences: Speak now in the ears of the people, and let every man borrow of his neighbour, and every woman of her neighbour, jewels of silver, and jewels of gold.
Wolaitta Sentences: Israa7eela asai, maccai attumai ba shoorotuppe biraappenne worqqaappe oosettida miishshata oichchana mala, etau oda" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And the LORD gave the people favour in the sight of the Egyptians. Moreover the man Moses was very great in the land of Egypt, in the sight of Pharaoh's servants, and in the sight of the people.
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAI Israa7eela asati Gibxxetu sinttan nashettanaadan oottiis. Qassi Muusee ba huuphenkka Gibxxe biittan kawuwaa sunttatuuninne asan keehi daro bonchchettida asadan xeelettiis.

English Sentences: And Moses said, Thus saith the LORD, About midnight will I go out into the midst of Egypt:
Wolaitta Sentences: Muusee kawuwaa hagaadan yaagiis; "GODAI hagaadan yaagees; Qammau gina shaahuwan taani Gibxxe gidduwaara kanttana;

English Sentences: And all the firstborn in the land of Egypt shall die, from the first born of Pharaoh that sitteth upon his throne, even unto the firstborn of the maidservant that is behind the mill; and all the firstborn of beasts.
Wolaitta Sentences: Gibxxe biittan de7iya baira attuma na7i ubbai, kawotaa araatan uttiya kawuwaa baira na7aappe doommidi, woxan gaacciya ashkkaree baira na7aa gakkanaassinne baira yelettida meheekka attennan ubbai haiqqana.

English Sentences: And there shall be a great cry throughout all the land of Egypt, such as there was none like it, nor shall be like it any more.
Wolaitta Sentences: Gibxxe biitta ubban hagaappe kase baggan hanibeennanne sinttappekka hanenna gita yeehoi yeehettana.

English Sentences: But against any of the children of Israel shall not a dog move his tongue, against man or beast: that ye may know how that the LORD doth put a difference between the Egyptians and Israel.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin Israa7eelatu gidduwan asa bolli woikko mehe bolli kaninne boccenna yaagees. He wode GODAI Gibxxe gidduwaaninne Israa7eela gidduwan zagaa medhdhiyoogaa neeni erana.

English Sentences: And all these thy servants shall come down unto me, and bow down themselves unto me, saying, Get thee out, and all the people that follow thee: and after that I will go out. And he went out from Pharaoh in a great anger.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ha ne sunttati ubbai duge taakko yiidi, ta sinttan gufannidi ziggana; ziggidi, Kiyada barkkii! Nena kaalliya asai ubbaikka bo! yaagana. Hegaappe guyyiyan taani baana" yaagiis. Hegaappe guyyiyan Muusee hanqquwaa suulliiddi, kawuwaa sinttappe kiyidi biis.

English Sentences: And the LORD said unto Moses, Pharaoh shall not hearken unto you; that my wonders may be multiplied in the land of Egypt.
Wolaitta Sentences: Muusessi GODAI kase, "Ta maalaalissiyaabai Gibxxe biittan darana mala, kawoi intte yootiyoogaa siyennan ixxana" yaagi wottiis.

English Sentences: And Moses and Aaron did all these wonders before Pharaoh: and the LORD hardened Pharaoh's heart, so that he would not let the children of Israel go out of his land.
Wolaitta Sentences: Muuseenne Aarooni ha maalaalissiyaabata ubbaa kawuwaa sinttan oottidosona; oottinkka GODAI kawuwaa wozanaa dammissiis; yaanin i Israa7eelata ba biittaappe yeddennan ixxiis.

English Sentences: And the LORD spake unto Moses and Aaron in the land of Egypt, saying,
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAI Gibxxe biittan Muusanne Aaroona hagaadan yaagiis;

English Sentences: This month shall be unto you the beginning of months: it shall be the first month of the year to you.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Ha aginai intteyyo laittau koiro agina gido;

English Sentences: Speak ye unto all the congregation of Israel, saying, In the tenth day of this month they shall take to them every man a lamb, according to the house of their fathers, a lamb for an house:
Wolaitta Sentences: Israa7eela asau ubbau ha wogaa odite; ha aginai gelido tammantta gallassan, issi asi ba so asau issi orgge dorssaa woikko issi orgge deeshshaa ekko.

English Sentences: And if the household be too little for the lamb, let him and his neighbour next unto his house take it according to the number of the souls; every man according to his eating shall make your count for the lamb.
Wolaitta Sentences: He keettaa asaa qoodai he dorssaa wurssi maanau guuxxikko, inne ayyo ubbaappe matattiya shooroi bantta so asaa qoodona; qoodidi issi issi asi maanau danddayiyo keenaa akeekidi, he mehiyaa shukkidi issippe moona.

English Sentences: Your lamb shall be without blemish, a male of the first year: ye shall take it out from the sheep, or from the goats:
Wolaitta Sentences: Intte doori ekkiyo mehee yelettoosappe issi laitta gididoogaa, a bollan aiba pacinne bainna attumaagaa gido bayin. Intte he meheta dorssappe woikko deeshshappe ekkanau danddayeeta.

English Sentences: And ye shall keep it up until the fourteenth day of the same month: and the whole assembly of the congregation of Israel shall kill it in the evening.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ha aginaayyo tammanne oiddantta gallassaa gakkanaassi eta heemmite; he gallassi omarssi lankkilankkiyaagan Israa7eela maabaraa asai ubbai eta shukkana koshshees.

English Sentences: And they shall take of the blood, and strike it on the two side posts and on the upper door post of the houses, wherein they shall eat it.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHukkidi suuttaappe amaridaagaa ekkidi, eti miyo keettau naa77u qosilettaanne qoriyaa tiyona;

English Sentences: And they shall eat the flesh in that night, roast with fire, and unleavened bread; and with bitter herbs they shall eat it.
Wolaitta Sentences: ashuwaa he gallassi qammikka taman xiixxi xiixxidi, cammiya bonccuwaaranne uukkido oittaara mona.

English Sentences: Eat not of it raw, nor sodden at all with water, but roast with fire; his head with his legs, and with the purtenance thereof.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ashuwaa qayye woikko doissidi mooppite; huuphiyaakka gedetakka qantta giddo ashuwaakka ubbaa xiixxidi miite;

English Sentences: And ye shall let nothing of it remain until the morning; and that which remaineth of it until the morning ye shall burn with fire.
Wolaitta Sentences: he ashuwaappe sa7ai wonttana gakkanaassi ainne ashshoppite; wonttana gakkanaassi amaridaagee attikko, hegaa xuugganau koshshees.

English Sentences: And thus shall ye eat it; with your loins girded, your shoes on your feet, and your staff in your hand; and ye shall eat it in haste: it is the LORD's passover.
Wolaitta Sentences: Muussaa miiddi, ogiyaassi giigiya maayuwaa maayidi, intte caammaa intte tohuwan wottidi, intte gatimaa intte kushiyan oiqqidi meeta. Eesuwan eesuwan miite; hagee GODAA Paasikaa.

English Sentences: For I will pass through the land of Egypt this night, and will smite all the firstborn in the land of Egypt, both man and beast; and against all the gods of Egypt I will execute judgment: I am the LORD.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Taani he gallassi qammi Gibxxeera kanttana; kanttaidda baira yelettida ubbaa, asaakka mehiyaakka worana; Gibxxe eeqatu ubbaa bollikka taani pirddana; taani GODAATTENNE.

English Sentences: And the blood shall be to you for a token upon the houses where ye are: and when I see the blood, I will pass over you, and the plague shall not be upon you to destroy you, when I smite the land of Egypt.
Wolaitta Sentences: He suuttai intte de7iyo keettata erissiya malaata gidana. Taani he suuttaa be7iyo wode, inttena aggada aadhdhana; taani Gibxxe biittaa boshan shociyo wode, inttena aiba boshikka bochchenna.

English Sentences: And this day shall be unto you for a memorial; and ye shall keep it a feast to the LORD throughout your generations; ye shall keep it a feast by an ordinance for ever.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Ha gallassai intteyyo hassayi hassayi bonchchiyo gallassa gido; intte yeletai ubbai GODAA baalaa bonchchite; hagaa woga oottidi merinau bonchchite.

English Sentences: Seven days shall ye eat unleavened bread; even the first day ye shall put away leaven out of your houses: for whosoever eateth leavened bread from the first day until the seventh day, that soul shall be cut off from Israel.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Laappun gallassai gakkanau irshshuwaa yeggibeenna oittaa miite; shin koiro gallassi irshshuwaa intte sooppe diggite. He koiro gallassaappe doommidi laappuntta gallassi gakkanaassi, irshshuwaara de7iya oitta miya asi Israa7eela asaa giddoppe duuxxidi xayo.

English Sentences: And in the first day there shall be an holy convocation, and in the seventh day there shall be an holy convocation to you; no manner of work shall be done in them, save that which every man must eat, that only may be done of you.
Wolaitta Sentences: Koiro gallassi geeshsha yaa7aa shiiqite; hara geeshsha yaa7aa qassi laappuntta gallassan shiiqite; asai ubbai maanau quma kattanaappe attin, ha gallassatu ubban ainne oottoppite; intte oottanabi hegaa xalaala.

English Sentences: And ye shall observe the feast of unleavened bread; for in this selfsame day have I brought your armies out of the land of Egypt: therefore shall ye observe this day in your generations by an ordinance for ever.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Oittaa Baalaa bonchchite; aissi giikko, taani intte citaa Gibxxe biittaappe kessidoi he gallassa. He gallassaa, yeletaappe yeletaa gakkanaashin kantti kiyiya woga oottidi bonchchite.

English Sentences: In the first month, on the fourteenth day of the month at even, ye shall eat unleavened bread, until the one and twentieth day of the month at even.
Wolaitta Sentences: Koiro aginan, he aginaayyo tammanne oiddantta gallassa omarssaappe doommidi, laatamanne isiinintta omarssa gakkanaassi irshshoi gelibeenna oittaa miite.

English Sentences: Seven days shall there be no leaven found in your houses: for whosoever eateth that which is leavened, even that soul shall be cut off from the congregation of Israel, whether he be a stranger, or born in the land.
Wolaitta Sentences: Laappun gallassa gakkanau irshshoi intte son beettoppo; irshshoi gelidobaa miya asi bete gidin woikko he biitta asa gidin, he aawu Israa7eela maabaraa giddoppe bohetto.

English Sentences: Ye shall eat nothing leavened; in all your habitations shall ye eat unleavened bread.
Wolaitta Sentences: Irshshoi gelidobaa aibanne mooppite; intte de7iyoosan awankka irshshoi gelibeenna oittaa maanau koshshees" yaagiis.

English Sentences: Then Moses called for all the elders of Israel, and said unto them, Draw out and take you a lamb according to your families, and kill the passover.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan Muusee Israa7eela cimata ubbaa xeesissidi eta hagaadan yaagiis; "Intte sohuwaarakka biidi, intte so asaassi Paasikau orgge dorssaa woikko orgge deeshshaa shukkite.

English Sentences: And ye shall take a bunch of hyssop, and dip it in the blood that is in the bason, and strike the lintel and the two side posts with the blood that is in the bason; and none of you shall go out at the door of his house until the morning.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hiisoophphiyaa giyo mittaa haittaappe dankki ekkidi, keriyan de7iya suuttan naaqqi kessidi, he suuttaa naa77u qosilettatanne qoriyaa tiyite; intteppe issi asinne sa7ai wonttana gakkanaassi ba keettaa penggeppe kare kiyoppo.

English Sentences: For the LORD will pass through to smite the Egyptians; and when he seeth the blood upon the lintel, and on the two side posts, the LORD will pass over the door, and will not suffer the destroyer to come in unto your houses to smite you.
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAI Gibxxeta shoci woranau he biittaara kanttiyo wode, suuttaa qoriyaaninne naa77u qosilettatun be7ana; be7idi kareera aadhdhi bayana; xaissiyaagee intte soo gelidi, inttena worennaadan a intte soo gelissenna.

English Sentences: And ye shall observe this thing for an ordinance to thee and to thy sons for ever.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Intte ha azazuwaa intteyyoonne intte zerettaayyo merinau woga oottidi azazettite.

English Sentences: And it shall come to pass, when ye be come to the land which the LORD will give you, according as he hath promised, that ye shall keep this service.
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAI kase immana giidoogaadan i immiyo biittaa intte geliyo wode, ha wogaa naagite.

English Sentences: And it shall come to pass, when your children shall say unto you, What mean ye by this service?
Wolaitta Sentences: Intte naati inttena, Ha bonchcho baalaa birshshettai aibee? yaagidi oichchiyo wode,

English Sentences: That ye shall say, It is the sacrifice of the LORD's passover, who passed over the houses of the children of Israel in Egypt, when he smote the Egyptians, and delivered our houses. And the people bowed the head and worshipped.
Wolaitta Sentences: intte eta, Hagee GODAA bonchchanau yarshshiyo Paasikaa yarshshuwaa; aissi giikko, GODAI Gibxxe biittan Israa7eela asaa keettaa aggi aadhdhidi biidi, Gibxxeta woriiddi, nuna ashshido gishshataassa yaagite" yaagiis. Hegaappe guyyiyan asai gulbbatidi goinniis.

English Sentences: And the children of Israel went away, and did as the LORD had commanded Moses and Aaron, so did they.
Wolaitta Sentences: Israa7eelati GODAI Muusanne Aaroona azazidoogaadan oottidosona.

English Sentences: And it came to pass, that at midnight the LORD smote all the firstborn in the land of Egypt, from the firstborn of Pharaoh that sat on his throne unto the firstborn of the captive that was in the dungeon; and all the firstborn of cattle.
Wolaitta Sentences: Qammau gina shaahuwan GODAI Gibxxen baira yelettida ubbaa, kawotaa araatan uttida kawuwaa baira na7aappe doommidi, qasho keettan de7iya omoodettidaageetu baira na7aa gakkanaassi, qassi baira yelettida mehiyaa ubbaa dippi oottiis.

English Sentences: And Pharaoh rose up in the night, he, and all his servants, and all the Egyptians; and there was a great cry in Egypt; for there was not a house where there was not one dead.
Wolaitta Sentences: Kawoi, a sunttati ubbainne Gibxxe biittaa asai ubbai qammi denddidosona. Gibxxe biittan asi haiqqibeenna keetti mulekka bainna gishshau, asai qaalaa xoqqu oottidi gita yeehuwaa yeekkiis.

English Sentences: And he called for Moses and Aaron by night, and said, Rise up, and get you forth from among my people, both ye and the children of Israel; and go, serve the LORD, as ye have said.
Wolaitta Sentences: He gallassa qammikka kawoi Muusanne Aaroona xeesidi, "Denddite! Inttekka Israa7eela asaikka ta asaa gidduwaappe kiyite! Biidi intte oichchidoogaadankka GODAAYYO goinnite!

English Sentences: Also take your flocks and your herds, as ye have said, and be gone; and bless me also.
Wolaitta Sentences: Intte giidoogaadankka intte dorssaa wudiyaanne intte mehiyaa wudiyaa ekkidi biite! Qassi tanakka anjjite" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And the Egyptians were urgent upon the people, that they might send them out of the land in haste; for they said, We be all dead men.
Wolaitta Sentences: Gibxxe asai Israa7eelati biittaappe eesuwan kiyana mala dirbbissidosona. Aissi giikko, eti, "Hinna xayikko, nuuni ubbaikka wuroos" yaagidosona.

English Sentences: And the people took their dough before it was leavened, their kneadingtroughs being bound up in their clothes upon their shoulders.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau, Israa7eela asati bantta irshshoi gelibeenna munaqaa munaqa keriyan kunttidi, bantta maayuwan xaaxidi, bantta hashiyan tookkidosona.

English Sentences: And the children of Israel did according to the word of Moses; and they borrowed of the Egyptians jewels of silver, and jewels of gold, and raiment:
Wolaitta Sentences: Israa7eelati Muusee eta azazidoogaadan, Gibxxeta bira miishshata, worqqa miishshatanne maayuwaa, "Immite" giidi oichchidosona.

English Sentences: And the LORD gave the people favour in the sight of the Egyptians, so that they lent unto them such things as they required. And they spoiled the Egyptians.
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAI Gibxxetu sinttan he asai sabettanaadan oottin, Gibxxeti eti oichchidobaa immidosona. Hegaadan yaatidi eti Gibxxe asatu aquwaa bonqqi ekkidi biidosona.

English Sentences: And the children of Israel journeyed from Rameses to Succoth, about six hundred thousand on foot that were men, beside children.
Wolaitta Sentences: Israa7eelati Raamisa giyo katamaappe denddidi Sukkota giyo sohuwaa tohuwan hemettidi biidosona. Asai naatanne maccaasaa gujjennan qoodin, usuppun xeetu sha7a.

English Sentences: And a mixed multitude went up also with them; and flocks, and herds, even very much cattle.
Wolaitta Sentences: Qassi etaara hara daro asai, daro meheenne dorssaa deeshshaa wudee laagettidi biis.

English Sentences: And they baked unleavened cakes of the dough which they brought forth out of Egypt, for it was not leavened; because they were thrust out of Egypt, and could not tarry, neither had they prepared for themselves any victual.
Wolaitta Sentences: Gibxxeppe eti ekkidi kiyido munaqaa irshshoi gelibeennaagaa oittaa uukkidosona; aissi giikko, eti Gibxxeppe dirbban kiyidosona; banttau shinqqe kattanaukka, munaqi denddin uukkanaukka eta gattibeenna.

English Sentences: Now the sojourning of the children of Israel, who dwelt in Egypt, was four hundred and thirty years.
Wolaitta Sentences: Israa7eelati Gibxxe biittan de7ido laittai oiddu xeetanne hasttama.

English Sentences: And it came to pass at the end of the four hundred and thirty years, even the selfsame day it came to pass, that all the hosts of the LORD went out from the land of Egypt.
Wolaitta Sentences: He oiddu xeetanne hasttamu laittai wuriyo he wurssetta gallassan, GODAA asai ubbai Gibxxe biittaappe kiyiis.

English Sentences: It is a night to be much observed unto the LORD for bringing them out from the land of Egypt: this is that night of the LORD to be observed of all the children of Israel in their generations.
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAI ba asaa naagidi, Gibxxe biittaappe kessiyo wode sa7ai qamma; he qammai yeletaappe yeletaa gakkanaassi, Israa7eela asai beegottidi naagiiddi aqiyo, GODAAYYO dummatida qamma.

English Sentences: And the LORD said unto Moses and Aaron, This is the ordinance of the passover: There shall no stranger eat thereof:
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAI Muusanne Aaroona, "Paasikaa gallassaa bonchchiyo wogai hageeho; bete asi appe mulekka mooppo.

English Sentences: But every man's servant that is bought for money, when thou hast circumcised him, then shall he eat thereof.
Wolaitta Sentences: Intte miishshan shammido aillee intte a qaxxaridoogaappe guyyiyan appe mo.

English Sentences: A foreigner and an hired servant shall not eat thereof.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin ha77issau inttenaara takkiya imattinne kera oottiya imatti appe mooppo.

English Sentences: In one house shall it be eaten; thou shalt not carry forth ought of the flesh abroad out of the house; neither shall ye break a bone thereof.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Ha Paasikaa intte issi keettan miite; intte he ashuwaappe aibanne kare kessoppite. Meqettatuppe issuwaanne menttoppite.

English Sentences: All the congregation of Israel shall keep it.
Wolaitta Sentences: Israa7eela maabarai ubbai Paasikaa bonchchanau koshshees.

English Sentences: And when a stranger shall sojourn with thee, and will keep the passover to the LORD, let all his males be circumcised, and then let him come near and keep it; and he shall be as one that is born in the land: for no uncircumcised person shall eat thereof.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Beti yiidi intte giddon de7iya asi GODAA Paasikaa bonchchanau koyikko, ba so attuma asa ubbaa qaxxaretto. Hegaappe guyyiyan i he biittan yelettida asadan shiiqidi, Paasikaa bonchchanau danddayees. SHin qaxxarettibeenna asi mulekka appe mooppo.

English Sentences: One law shall be to him that is homeborn, and unto the stranger that sojourneth among you.
Wolaitta Sentences: Intte biittan yelettidaagaukka intte giddon bete gididi de7iyaagaukka he wogai issuwaa" yaagiis.

English Sentences: Thus did all the children of Israel; as the LORD commanded Moses and Aaron, so did they.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin Israa7eelati ubbai GODAI Muusanne Aaroona azazidoogaadankka oottidosona.

English Sentences: And it came to pass the selfsame day, that the LORD did bring the children of Israel out of the land of Egypt by their armies.
Wolaitta Sentences: He gallassikka GODAI Israa7eelata eta citan citan Gibxxe biittaappe kessiis.

English Sentences: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAI Muusa hagaadan yaagiis;

English Sentences: Sanctify unto me all the firstborn, whatsoever openeth the womb among the children of Israel, both of man and of beast: it is mine.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Baira yelettida attuma ubbaa taayyo dummaya. Israa7eela asaa giddon uloppe yelettida bairi ubbi, mehiyaa gidin asaa gidin, ubbaikka tabaa" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And Moses said unto the people, Remember this day, in which ye came out from Egypt, out of the house of bondage; for by strength of hand the LORD brought you out from this place: there shall no leavened bread be eaten.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan Muusee asaa, "Gibxxeppe, ailletettaa biittaappe intte kiyido gallassaa, ha gallassaa hassayite; aissi giikko, GODAI ba wolqqaama kushiyan inttena kessiis; hegaa gishshau, irshshoi gelidobaa aibanne mooppite.

English Sentences: This day came ye out in the month Abib.
Wolaitta Sentences: Intte hachchi Abiiba aginan kiyeeta.

English Sentences: And it shall be when the LORD shall bring thee into the land of the Canaanites, and the Hittites, and the Amorites, and the Hivites, and the Jebusites, which he sware unto thy fathers to give thee, a land flowing with milk and honey, that thou shalt keep this service in this month.
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAI Kanaanetu, Hiitetu, Amooretu, Hiiwetunne Yaabuusatu biittaa inttena gattiyo wode, intte ha bonchcho gallassaa ha aginaa bonchcheeta. He biittai GODAI inttessi immana mala, kase intte aawatussi caaqqi wottido biittaa. He biittai maattainne eessai goggiyo biittaa.

English Sentences: Seven days thou shalt eat unleavened bread, and in the seventh day shall be a feast to the LORD.
Wolaitta Sentences: Intte laappun gallassi irshshoi yegettibeenna oittaa maana; laappuntta gallassai GODAA baalaa gidana.

English Sentences: Unleavened bread shall be eaten seven days; and there shall no leavened bread be seen with thee, neither shall there be leaven seen with thee in all thy quarters.
Wolaitta Sentences: He laappun gallassatun irshshoi yegettibeenna oittaa intte maana; intte giddon irshshoora de7iyaabi aibinne beettoppo; ne biittaa zawan awaaninne irshshoi beettoppo.

English Sentences: And thou shalt shew thy son in that day, saying, This is done because of that which the LORD did unto me when I came forth out of Egypt.
Wolaitta Sentences: "He gallassi neeni ne na7aayyo, Taani hagaa oottiyoogee, taani Gibxxeppe kiyiyo wode, GODAI taayyo oottidoogaa hassayanaassa yaagada yoota.

English Sentences: And it shall be for a sign unto thee upon thine hand, and for a memorial between thine eyes, that the LORD's law may be in thy mouth: for with a strong hand hath the LORD brought thee out of Egypt.
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAI inttena ba wolqqaama kushiyan Gibxxeppe kessido gishshau, GODAA higgee intte doonaappe wodhdhennaadan, ha bonchchettiya ayyaana gallassai ne kushiyan qachchidonne ne merchchiyan wottido hassayissiyaabaa mala gidana.

English Sentences: Thou shalt therefore keep this ordinance in his season from year to year.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau, intte ha wogaa laittan laittan keerido wodiyan bonchchite.

English Sentences: And it shall be when the LORD shall bring thee into the land of the Canaanites, as he sware unto thee and to thy fathers, and shall give it thee,
Wolaitta Sentences: "GODAI intteyyoonne intte maizza aawatuyyo immanau caaqqidoogaadan, i inttena Kanaanetu biittaa gelissidi, he biittaa intteyyo immiyo wode,

English Sentences: That thou shalt set apart unto the LORD all that openeth the matrix, and every firstling that cometh of a beast which thou hast; the males shall be the LORD's.
Wolaitta Sentences: uloppe baira yelettida ubbaa GODAAYYO dummaya; ne mehiyan baira yelettiya attuma ubbai GODAASSA.

English Sentences: And every firstling of an ass thou shalt redeem with a lamb; and if thou wilt not redeem it, then thou shalt break his neck: and all the firstborn of man among thy children shalt thou redeem.
Wolaitta Sentences: Baira yelettiya hare ubbaa dorssa maran woza ekka; wozennabaa gidikko, a morggiyaa mentta; ne attuma naatu giddon baira yelettidaageeta ubbaa woza.

English Sentences: And it shall be when thy son asketh thee in time to come, saying, What is this? that thou shalt say unto him, By strength of hand the LORD brought us out from Egypt, from the house of bondage:
Wolaitta Sentences: Sinttaara yaana wodiyan ne na7ai nena, Hagee aibee? yaagidi oichchikko, neeni a, GODAI nuna wolqqaama kushiyan Gibxxeppe, ailletettaa biittaappe kessiis;

English Sentences: And it came to pass, when Pharaoh would hardly let us go, that the LORD slew all the firstborn in the land of Egypt, both the firstborn of man, and the firstborn of beast: therefore I sacrifice to the LORD all that openeth the matrix, being males; but all the firstborn of my children I redeem.
Wolaitta Sentences: Gibxxe kawoi dammidi nuna yeddennan ixxin, GODAI Gibxxe biittan de7iya baira ubbaa, asaappe doommidi mehiyaa bairaa gakkanaassi woriis. Taani aayi uloppe koiro yelettida attumaa ubbaa GODAASSI yarshshiyoogeenne ta baira attuma naata taani woziyoogee hegaassa yaaga.

English Sentences: And it shall be for a token upon thine hand, and for frontlets between thine eyes: for by strength of hand the LORD brought us forth out of Egypt.
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAI nuna ba wolqqaama kushiyan Gibxxeppe kessidoogau, hagee intteyyo kushen qachchidonne merchchen wottido malaata mala gidana" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And it came to pass, when Pharaoh had let the people go, that God led them not through the way of the land of the Philistines, although that was near; for God said, Lest peradventure the people repent when they see war, and they return to Egypt:
Wolaitta Sentences: Kawoi asaa yeddido wode, Xoossai eta Pilisxxeema biittaara kanttissiya ogee mata gidikkonne he ogiyaara kaalettibeenna; aissi giikko, Xoossai, "Asai olaa be7ikko, ba qofaa laammidi, guyye Gibxxe simmanaakkonne" yaagidi qoppiis.

English Sentences: But God led the people about, through the way of the wilderness of the Red sea: and the children of Israel went up harnessed out of the land of Egypt.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau, Xoossai asaa bazzo ogiyaara yuushshidi, Zo7o Abbaakko kaalettiis. Israa7eelati Gibxxe biittaappe olau giigidi pude kiyidosona.

English Sentences: And Moses took the bones of Joseph with him: for he had straitly sworn the children of Israel, saying, God will surely visit you; and ye shall carry up my bones away hence with you.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yooseefi Israa7eela asaa caaqetti wottido gishshau, Muusee a meqettaa banaara ekkidi biis; Yooseefi eta, "Xoossai tumuppe inttena maaddanau yaana; he wode intte ta meqettaa ha sohuwaappe pude inttenaara ekkidi biite" yaagidi odi wottiis.

English Sentences: And they took their journey from Succoth, and encamped in Etham, in the edge of the wilderness.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti Sukkotappe denddidi bazzuwaa doonan de7iya Etaaman uttidosona.

English Sentences: And the LORD went before them by day in a pillar of a cloud, to lead them the way; and by night in a pillar of fire, to give them light; to go by day and night:
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAI eti gallassikka qammikka hemettana mala, gallassan eta ogiyaa bessanau shaaraa tuussan, qammi etau poo7issanau tamaa tuussan eta kaalettiis.

English Sentences: He took not away the pillar of the cloud by day, nor the pillar of fire by night, from before the people.
Wolaitta Sentences: Gallassi shaaraa tuussai woikko qammi tamaa tuussai asaa sinttappe kichchibeenna.

English Sentences: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan Muusa GODAI hagaadan yaagiis;

English Sentences: Speak unto the children of Israel, that they turn and encamp before Pihahiroth, between Migdol and the sea, over against Baalzephon: before it shall ye encamp by the sea.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Eti guyye simmidi Migidoolappenne abbaappe gidduwan, Pihaahiroota matan uttanaadan oda; eti abbaa lanqqen Ba7aali-Xafoonau sintta baazzan uttona.

English Sentences: For Pharaoh will say of the children of Israel, They are entangled in the land, the wilderness hath shut them in.
Wolaitta Sentences: Kawoi, Israa7eelati bazzoi gorddin, haniyoobaa xayidi biittan coo toilattoosona yaagidi qoppana.

English Sentences: And I will harden Pharaoh's heart, that he shall follow after them; and I will be honoured upon Pharaoh, and upon all his host; that the Egyptians may know that I am the LORD. And they did so.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani kawuwaa wozanaa dammissana; i eta yedettana; taani kawuwaa baggaaranne a olanchchatu ubbaa baggaara taani bonchchettana; Gibxxetinne taani GODAA gidiyoogaa erana" yaagiis. Yaagin Israa7eelati i yootidoogaadan oottidosona.

English Sentences: And it was told the king of Egypt that the people fled: and the heart of Pharaoh and of his servants was turned against the people, and they said, Why have we done this, that we have let Israel go from serving us?
Wolaitta Sentences: Asai baqatiichchidoogaa Gibxxe kawuwaayyo yootin, inne a sunttati Israa7eelatuyyo qoppido bantta qofaa laammidi, "Nuuni hagaa waatiyoonii? Nuuni Israa7eelata yeddidi, eti nuuyyo oottiyo wolqqaappe mela attida" yaagidosona.

English Sentences: And he made ready his chariot, and took his people with him:
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau, i ba para gaariyaa kooridi, ba olanchchata banaara ekkidi denddiis.

English Sentences: And he took six hundred chosen chariots, and all the chariots of Egypt, and captains over every one of them.
Wolaitta Sentences: I usuppun xeetu ubbaappe aadhdhiya para gaareta, Gibxxe biittan de7iya hara gaaretu ubbaara, eta ubbau halaqaa halaqaa sunttidi ekkidi biis.

English Sentences: And the LORD hardened the heart of Pharaoh king of Egypt, and he pursued after the children of Israel: and the children of Israel went out with an high hand.
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAI Gibxxe biittaa kawuwaa, kawuwaa wozanaa dammissin, kessaa bolli de7iya Israa7eela asaa yedettiis.

English Sentences: But the Egyptians pursued after them, all the horses and chariots of Pharaoh, and his horsemen, and his army, and overtook them encamping by the sea, beside Pihahiroth, before Baalzephon.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan Gibxxe asati, kawuwaa parati ubbainne paraa gaareti, paraasatinne olanchchati Israa7eelata kaallidi yedettidosona. Abbaa doonan Ba7aali-Xafoona sintta baazzan de7iya Pihaahiroota matan eti uttidaashin demmidosona.

English Sentences: And when Pharaoh drew nigh, the children of Israel lifted up their eyes, and, behold, the Egyptians marched after them; and they were sore afraid: and the children of Israel cried out unto the LORD.
Wolaitta Sentences: Kawoi matiichchin, Israa7eelati xoqqu gi xeelliyo wode, Gibxxeti eta geeduwaa kaallidi yiidoogaa be7idosona; be7idi daroppe yayyidi, GODAAYYO waassidosona.

English Sentences: And they said unto Moses, Because there were no graves in Egypt, hast thou taken us away to die in the wilderness? wherefore hast thou dealt thus with us, to carry us forth out of Egypt?
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti Muusa, "Neeni nuna Gibxxen duufoi xayin bazzon haiqqanaadan kessadiiyye? Nuna Gibxxeppe aibau ehaadii?

English Sentences: Is not this the word that we did tell thee in Egypt, saying, Let us alone, that we may serve the Egyptians? For it had been better for us to serve the Egyptians, than that we should die in the wilderness.
Wolaitta Sentences: Gibxxen de7iiddi nuuni, Nuna aggaaga; nuuni Gibxxetuyyo haarettana yaagidi neeyyo odibookkonii? Bazzon haiqqanaappe etayyo haarettiyoogee nuuyyo lo77o shin" yaagidosona.

English Sentences: And Moses said unto the people, Fear ye not, stand still, and see the salvation of the LORD, which he will shew to you to day: for the Egyptians whom ye have seen to day, ye shall see them again no more for ever.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin Muusee asaa, "Yayyoppite; minni eqqite; GODAI hachchi inttena ashshiyo ashettaa intte be7ana. Hachchi intte be7iyo Gibxxeta naa77antto mulekka be7ekketa.

English Sentences: The LORD shall fight for you, and ye shall hold your peace.
Wolaitta Sentences: Intte gishshaa GODAI olettana; intteppe koyettiyai co77u geetta xalaala" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And the LORD said unto Moses, Wherefore criest thou unto me? speak unto the children of Israel, that they go forward:
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAI Muusa, "Neeni taakko aissi waassai? Israa7eelati sinttau hemettana mala yoota.

English Sentences: But lift thou up thy rod, and stretch out thine hand over the sea, and divide it: and the children of Israel shall go on dry ground through the midst of the sea.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ne gatimaa dentta; denttada abbaa bolli micca; haattai naa77u kiyidi shaahettana; Israa7eelatikka mela biittaara abbaa pinnidi baana.

English Sentences: And I, behold, I will harden the hearts of the Egyptians, and they shall follow them: and I will get me honour upon Pharaoh, and upon all his host, upon his chariots, and upon his horsemen.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani Gibxxetu wozanaa dammissin, eti intte geeduwaa kaallidi abban gelana. Taani kawuwaanne a olanchchatu ubbaa baggaara, a para gaaretunne a paraasatu baggaara bonchchuwaa taayyo demmana.

English Sentences: And the Egyptians shall know that I am the LORD, when I have gotten me honour upon Pharaoh, upon his chariots, and upon his horsemen.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani kawuwaa baggaara, a para gaaretu baggaaranne a paraasatu baggaara taayyo bonchchuwaa demmido wode, taani GODAA gidiyoogaa Gibxxeti erana" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And the angel of God, which went before the camp of Israel, removed and went behind them; and the pillar of the cloud went from before their face, and stood behind them:
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan Xoossaa kiitanchchai, Israa7eela olanchchatuppe sinttaara hemettiyaagee, guyye aadhdhidi etappe guyyeera hemettiis. SHaaraa tuussaikka eta sinttan de7iyoosaappe guyye baggi yuuyidi,

English Sentences: And it came between the camp of the Egyptians and the camp of Israel; and it was a cloud and darkness to them, but it gave light by night to these: so that the one came not near the other all the night.
Wolaitta Sentences: Gibxxetu olanchchatuppenne Israa7eelatu olanchchatuppe gidduwan eqqiis. He shaarai qamma ubban issi baggaara xumissidi, hinkko baggaara poo7issiis; yaatin qamma ubbaa issoi issuwaakko shiiqibookkona.

English Sentences: And Moses stretched out his hand over the sea; and the LORD caused the sea to go back by a strong east wind all that night, and made the sea dry land, and the waters were divided.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan Muusee abbaa bollan ba kushiyaa micciis; GODAI he gallassi qamma ubban arshsho wolqqaama carkkuwaa yeddidi, abbaa guyye zaariis; zaaridi mela biitta kessiis. Haattai shaahettiis.

English Sentences: And the children of Israel went into the midst of the sea upon the dry ground: and the waters were a wall unto them on their right hand, and on their left.
Wolaitta Sentences: Israa7eelati abbaa gidduwan mela biittaara hemettidi, haattai etayyo ushachchaaranne haddirssaara godadan eqqidaashin biidosona.

English Sentences: And the Egyptians pursued, and went in after them to the midst of the sea, even all Pharaoh's horses, his chariots, and his horsemen.
Wolaitta Sentences: Gibxxeti eta yedettidosona; kawuwaa para ubbati, a para gaaretinne a paraasati eta kaallidi, abbaa giddo gelidosona.

English Sentences: And it came to pass, that in the morning watch the LORD looked unto the host of the Egyptians through the pillar of fire and of the cloud, and troubled the host of the Egyptians,
Wolaitta Sentences: Biron bakkaalee dolanaappe kasetidi, GODAI tamaanne shaaraa tuussaappe duge zaaridi, Gibxxetu olanchchata xeelliis; xeellidi eta wozanaa bashshiis.

English Sentences: And took off their chariot wheels, that they drave them heavily: so that the Egyptians said, Let us flee from the face of Israel; for the LORD fighteth for them against the Egyptians.
Wolaitta Sentences: Laagoi eta waissana mala, GODAI eta para gaaretu irzzuwaa binqqirssaa diggiis; diggin Gibxxeti, "GODAI eta maaddidi Gibxxe oliyo gishshau, ane nuuni Israa7eela asaappe baqatoos" yaagidosona.

English Sentences: And the LORD said unto Moses, Stretch out thine hand over the sea, that the waters may come again upon the Egyptians, upon their chariots, and upon their horsemen.
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAI Muusa, "Haattai Gibxxetu bolli, eta para gaaretu bollinne eta paraasatu bolli guyye goggana mala, ne kushiyaa abbaa bollan micca" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And Moses stretched forth his hand over the sea, and the sea returned to his strength when the morning appeared; and the Egyptians fled against it; and the LORD overthrew the Egyptians in the midst of the sea.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin Muusee ba kushiyaa abbaa bollan micciis; sa7ai wonttishin, abbai ba kase sohuwaa guyye simmiis; Gibxxeti yaa a giddo baqatishin, GODAI Gibxxeta abbaa gidduwan aatti yeggiis.

English Sentences: And the waters returned, and covered the chariots, and the horsemen, and all the host of Pharaoh that came into the sea after them; there remained not so much as one of them.
Wolaitta Sentences: Haattai guyye simmidi, para gaareta paraasatanne Israa7eelata kaallidi abbaa gelida kawuwaa olanchchata muliyaa mitti bayiis; etappe issoinne attibeenna.

English Sentences: But the children of Israel walked upon dry land in the midst of the sea; and the waters were a wall unto them on their right hand, and on their left.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin Israa7eelati abbaa gidduwaara mela biittan hemettidi, haattai etau ushachchaaranne haddirssaara godadan eqqidaashin biidosona.

English Sentences: Thus the LORD saved Israel that day out of the hand of the Egyptians; and Israel saw the Egyptians dead upon the sea shore.
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAI he gallassi Israa7eela asaa Gibxxetu kushiyaappe hagaadan ashshiis. Qassi Israa7eelati Gibxxeti haiqqidi zin77idaageeta abbaa doonan be7idosona.

English Sentences: And Israel saw that great work which the LORD did upon the Egyptians: and the people feared the LORD, and believed the LORD, and his servant Moses.
Wolaitta Sentences: Israa7eelatikka GODAI Gibxxetu bolli bessido gita wolqqaa be7ido wode, asai GODAAYYO yayyiis; yayyidi akka a ashkkaraa Muusakka ammaniis.

English Sentences: Then sang Moses and the children of Israel this song unto the LORD, and spake, saying, I will sing unto the LORD, for he hath triumphed gloriously: the horse and his rider hath he thrown into the sea.
Wolaitta Sentences: He wode Muuseenne Israa7eela asai ha mazamuriyaa GODAAYYO yexxidosona; "Bonchchuwan i keehi xoqqu xoqqu giido gishshau, taani GODAAYYO mazamuriyaa yexxana. Paraanne paraa toggidaagaa abban oliis.

English Sentences: The LORD is my strength and song, and he is become my salvation: he is my God, and I will prepare him an habitation; my father's God, and I will exalt him.
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAI ta wolqqaanne ta mazamuriyaa; i tana ashshiyaagaa gidiis. I ta Xoossaa; taani a sabbana. I ta aawaa Xoossaa; taani a xoqqu xoqqu oottana.

English Sentences: The LORD is a man of war: the LORD is his name.
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAI olanchcha; a sunttaikka GODAA.

English Sentences: Pharaoh's chariots and his host hath he cast into the sea: his chosen captains also are drowned in the Red sea.
Wolaitta Sentences: Gibxxe kawuwaa para gaaretanne a olanchchata abban oliis. Gibxxe kawuwaa halaqati, ubbaappe aadhdhi lo77iyaageeti Zo7o Abban muukettidosona.

English Sentences: The depths have covered them: they sank into the bottom as a stone.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ciimma haattai eta kammiis; eti shuchchadan ciimman mitettidosona.

English Sentences: Thy right hand, O LORD, is become glorious in power: thy right hand, O LORD, hath dashed in pieces the enemy.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Abeet GODAU, ne ushachcha kushee wolqqan goobidaagaa; GODAU, ne ushachcha kushee morkkiyaa mentterettiis.

English Sentences: And in the greatness of thine excellency thou hast overthrown them that rose up against thee: thou sentest forth thy wrath, which consumed them as stubble.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ne bonchchuwaa gitatettan nenaara gaaddetidaageeta oladasa. Ne eexxiya hanqquwaa neeni yeddin, i eta daladan miis.

English Sentences: And with the blast of thy nostrils the waters were gathered together, the floods stood upright as an heap, and the depths were congealed in the heart of the sea.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ne siiriyaara kiyiya shemppuwan haattai doorettiis. Goggiya haattainne godadan minni eqqiis; ciimma haattati abbaa gomppan irkkidi minnidosona.

English Sentences: The enemy said, I will pursue, I will overtake, I will divide the spoil; my lust shall be satisfied upon them; I will draw my sword, my hand shall destroy them.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Morkkee ceeqettiiddi, Taani eta yedettada oiqqana. Taani eta aquwaa shaakkada, ta koyidobaa ubbaa ekkana. Taani ta bisuwaa shoddada, eta xaissana yaagidi ceeqettiis.

English Sentences: Thou didst blow with thy wind, the sea covered them: they sank as lead in the mighty waters.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin neeni eta ne shemppuwan punnin, abbai eta kammiis. Eti wolqqaama haattan irssaasiyaa giyo biratai mitettiyoogaadan mitettidosona.

English Sentences: Who is like unto thee, O LORD, among the gods? who is like thee, glorious in holiness, fearful in praises, doing wonders?
Wolaitta Sentences: Abeet GODAU, Xoossatu giddon ne malai oonee? Geeshshatettan bonchchettiyaabi, bonchchuwan yayettiyaabi, garamiyaabaa oottiyaabi ne malai oonee?

English Sentences: Thou stretchedst out thy right hand, the earth swallowed them.
Wolaitta Sentences: Neeni ne ushachcha kushiyaa miccin, biittai eta mittiis.

English Sentences: Thou in thy mercy hast led forth the people which thou hast redeemed: thou hast guided them in thy strength unto thy holy habitation.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Neeni wozido asaa aggenna ne siiquwan kaalettana. Neeni ne wolqqan eta neeni de7iyo geeshsha sohuwaa gelissadasa.

English Sentences: The people shall hear, and be afraid: sorrow shall take hold on the inhabitants of Palestina.
Wolaitta Sentences: Kawotettati hegaa siyidi kokkoridosona. Pilisxxeema biittaa asatikka maareti oiqqidobaadan un77ettidosona.

English Sentences: Then the dukes of Edom shall be amazed; the mighty men of Moab, trembling shall take hold upon them; all the inhabitants of Canaan shall melt away.
Wolaitta Sentences: He wode Eedooma biittaa halaqati dagammidosona. Moo7aaba biittaa haariyaageeta yashshai kokkorssiis. Kanaane asati maashidosona.

English Sentences: Fear and dread shall fall upon them; by the greatness of thine arm they shall be as still as a stone; till thy people pass over, O LORD, till the people pass over, which thou hast purchased.
Wolaitta Sentences: Dagamainne yashshai eta oiqqiis. Abeet GODAU, eti ne wolqqaa gitatettaa be7idi, ne asai aadhdhana gakkanaassi, neeni wozido asai aadhdhana gakkanaassi, shuchchadan tolettidi eqqidosona.

English Sentences: Thou shalt bring them in, and plant them in the mountain of thine inheritance, in the place, O LORD, which thou hast made for thee to dwell in, in the Sanctuary, O LORD, which thy hands have established.
Wolaitta Sentences: Neeni eta ehaada, ne buzo gaden de7iya deriyaa huuphiyan tokkana. Abeet Godau, he sohoi neeni neeyyo de7anau oottido soho. Abeet Godau, he geeshsha sohoi neeni ne kushiyan minttada essido soho.

English Sentences: The LORD shall reign for ever and ever.
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAI merinaappe merinau kawotana" yaagidi yexxidosona.

English Sentences: For the horse of Pharaoh went in with his chariots and with his horsemen into the sea, and the LORD brought again the waters of the sea upon them; but the children of Israel went on dry land in the midst of the sea.
Wolaitta Sentences: Gibxxe kawuwaa parati, a para gaaretinne a paraasati abban gelido wode, GODAI eta bolli abbaa haattaa guyye zaaridi eta bolli ehiis; shin Israa7eelati abbaa gidduwaara mela biittaara hemettidi biidosona.

English Sentences: And Miriam the prophetess, the sister of Aaron, took a timbrel in her hand; and all the women went out after her with timbrels and with dances.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aaroona michchiyaa, hananabaa yootiya Miiriyaama karaabiyaa ekkaasu; maccaasai ubbai karaabiyaa baqqiiddinne yexxiiddi o kaallidosona.

English Sentences: And Miriam answered them, Sing ye to the LORD, for he hath triumphed gloriously; the horse and his rider hath he thrown into the sea.
Wolaitta Sentences: Miiriyaama etayyo mazamuriyaa yexxaidda, "GODAI keehi xoqqu xoqqu giido gishshau, ayyo yexxite. Paraanne paraa toggidaagaa i abban oliis" yaagada yexxaasu.

English Sentences: So Moses brought Israel from the Red sea, and they went out into the wilderness of Shur; and they went three days in the wilderness, and found no water.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan Muusee Israa7eela Zo7o Abbaappe kaalettin, eti Suura giyo bazzuwaa biidosona. He bazzuwan eti haatta demmennan heezzu gallassaa hemettidosona.

English Sentences: And when they came to Marah, they could not drink of the waters of Marah, for they were bitter: therefore the name of it was called Marah.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti Maara giyoosaa gakkido wode, Maara haattai camo gidido gishshau, uyana danddayibookkona; hegaa gishshau, he sohoi Maara geetettiis.

English Sentences: And the people murmured against Moses, saying, What shall we drink?
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau, asai, "Nuuni ai uyanee?" yaagidi Muuse bolli zuuzummiis.

English Sentences: And he cried unto the LORD; and the LORD shewed him a tree, which when he had cast into the waters, the waters were made sweet: there he made for them a statute and an ordinance, and there he proved them,
Wolaitta Sentences: Zuuzummin Muusee GODAAYYO waassiis; waassin GODAI a issi mitta bessiis; Muusee he mittaa haatta giddo olin, haattai mal77iis. Yan GODAI etau awaajuwaanne higgiyaa kessiis; yan GODAI eta paacciis.

English Sentences: And said, If thou wilt diligently hearken to the voice of the LORD thy God, and wilt do that which is right in his sight, and wilt give ear to his commandments, and keep all his statutes, I will put none of these diseases upon thee, which I have brought upon the Egyptians: for I am the LORD that healeth thee.
Wolaitta Sentences: I eta hagaadan yaagiis; "GODAI intte Xoossai odiyoobaa minttidi siyikkonne a aifiyaa sinttan likkebaa oottikko, intte a azazuwaa ezggikkonne a awaajuwaa ubbaa naagikko, taani Gibxxetu bolli ehiido harggiyaappe issuwaanne intte bolli ehiikke; aissi giikko, taani inttena pattiya GODAATTENNE" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And they came to Elim, where were twelve wells of water, and threescore and ten palm trees: and they encamped there by the waters.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe eti Elaama biitti yiidosona; yan tammanne naa77u haatta pulttotinne laappun tammu zambba mittati de7oosona. Eti yan haattaa doonan uttidosona.

English Sentences: And they took their journey from Elim, and all the congregation of the children of Israel came unto the wilderness of Sin, which is between Elim and Sinai, on the fifteenth day of the second month after their departing out of the land of Egypt.
Wolaitta Sentences: Gibxxeppe kiyido naa77antto aginan, tammanne ichchashantto gallassan Israa7eela asaa maabarai kumettai Eliimappe denddidi, Eliimappenne Siinaappe gidduwan de7iya Siinaa giyo bazzuwaa yiis.

English Sentences: And the whole congregation of the children of Israel murmured against Moses and Aaron in the wilderness:
Wolaitta Sentences: Israa7eela asaa maabarai ubbai bazzuwan Muuse bollinne Aaroona bolli zuuzummidosona.

English Sentences: And the children of Israel said unto them, Would to God we had died by the hand of the LORD in the land of Egypt, when we sat by the flesh pots, and when we did eat bread to the full; for ye have brought us forth into this wilderness, to kill this whole assembly with hunger.
Wolaitta Sentences: Israa7eelati eta, "Nuuni Gibxxe biittan GODAA kushiyan haiqqidaa gidorkkoniishsha! Yan nuuni nuugaa ashuwaa keriyaa yuuyi aadhdhi uttidi, nuuni koyido qumaa ubbaa miida; shin intte nuna kessidi, ha geeshsha yaa7aa ubbaa namisan woranau bazzo ehiideta" yaagidosona.

English Sentences: Then said the LORD unto Moses, Behold, I will rain bread from heaven for you; and the people shall go out and gather a certain rate every day, that I may prove them, whether they will walk in my law, or no.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin GODAI Muusa, "Taani intteyyo saluwaappe oittaa bukissana; asai ubba gallassikka kiyidi, hachchi hachchissi gidiyaagaa xalaalaa maxanau koshshees. Asai ta azazuwaa kaalliyaakko kaallennaakko taani eta hegan paaccana.

English Sentences: And it shall come to pass, that on the sixth day they shall prepare that which they bring in; and it shall be twice as much as they gather daily.
Wolaitta Sentences: Usuppuntta gallassi eti haroode maxiyoogau naa77u kushiyaa maxidi, kattona" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And Moses and Aaron said unto all the children of Israel, At even, then ye shall know that the LORD hath brought you out from the land of Egypt:
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau, Muuseenne Aarooni Israa7eela asa ubbaayyo, "Inttena Gibxxe biittaappe kessidaagee GODAA gidiyoogaa omarssi intte erana;

English Sentences: And in the morning, then ye shall see the glory of the LORD; for that he heareth your murmurings against the LORD: and what are we, that ye murmur against us?
Wolaitta Sentences: qassi GODAA bonchchuwaa maallado intte be7ana; aissi giikko, a bolli intte zuuzummidoogaa i siyiis; intte nu bolli zuuzummanau nuuni oonee?" yaagidosona.

English Sentences: And Moses said, This shall be, when the LORD shall give you in the evening flesh to eat, and in the morning bread to the full; for that the LORD heareth your murmurings which ye murmur against him: and what are we? your murmurings are not against us, but against the LORD.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan Muusee, "I intteyyo maanau omarssi ashuwaa immiininne intte koyiyo oittaa ubbaa intteyyo maallado immin, i GODAA gidiyoogaa intte hegan erana. Aissi giikko, intte a bolli zuuzummidoogaa i siyiis. Nuuni oonee? Intte nu bolli zuuzummekketa; intte GODAA bolli zuuzummeeta" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And Moses spake unto Aaron, Say unto all the congregation of the children of Israel, Come near before the LORD: for he hath heard your murmurings.
Wolaitta Sentences: Muusee Aaroona, "Neeni Israa7eela asaa maabara ubbaa, GODAI intte zuuzunttaa siyido gishshau, GODAA sintti haa shiiqite yaaga" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And it came to pass, as Aaron spake unto the whole congregation of the children of Israel, that they looked toward the wilderness, and, behold, the glory of the LORD appeared in the cloud.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aarooni Israa7eela asaa maabara ubbau haasayissishin, eti bazzuwaakko simmidi xeellidosona; hegan GODAA bonchchoi shaara giddon qoncciyaagaa be7idosona.

English Sentences: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAI Muusa, "Taani Israa7eelatu zuuzunttaa siyaas;

English Sentences: I have heard the murmurings of the children of Israel: speak unto them, saying, At even ye shall eat flesh, and in the morning ye shall be filled with bread; and ye shall know that I am the LORD your God.
Wolaitta Sentences: neeni etayyo, Omarssan ashuwaa intte maana; maallado oittaa intte kallana; he wode intte taani GODAA intte Xoossaa gidiyoogaa erana yaagada yoota" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And it came to pass, that at even the quails came up, and covered the camp: and in the morning the dew lay round about the host.
Wolaitta Sentences: He gallassi omarssan kuraachchoti yiidi, Israa7eela asai de7iyoosaa maayidosona; qassi maallado eta dunkkaanetu yuushuwan xaazai xaazaa bolli yekekki uttiis.

English Sentences: And when the dew that lay was gone up, behold, upon the face of the wilderness there lay a small round thing, as small as the hoar frost on the ground.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xaazai xaskkido wode, sa7an wodhdhida shachcha misatiya burcce poqoi bazzo biittaa bollan beettiis.

English Sentences: And when the children of Israel saw it, they said one to another, It is manna: for they wist not what it was. And Moses said unto them, This is the bread which the LORD hath given you to eat.
Wolaitta Sentences: Israa7eelati hegaa be7ido wode, eti issoi issuwaa, "Hagee aibee?" yaagidosona. Aissi giikko, eti i aibakko eribookkona. Yaatin Muusee eta, "Intteyyo maanau GODAI immido oittai hagaa.

English Sentences: This is the thing which the LORD hath commanded, Gather of it every man according to his eating, an omer for every man, according to the number of your persons; take ye every man for them which are in his tents.
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAI hagaadan yaagidi azaziis; Asai issoi issoi baayyo maanau koshshiyaagaa keenaa shiishsho; intte dunkkaane giddon de7iya asai huuphiyan huuphiyan naa77u litiro gidiyaagaa ekkite yaagiis" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And the children of Israel did so, and gathered, some more, some less.
Wolaitta Sentences: Israa7eelati Muusee etau yootidoogaadan oottidosona; issoi darissidi, issoi guuttidi shiishshidosona.

English Sentences: And when they did mete it with an omer, he that gathered much had nothing over, and he that gathered little had no lack; they gathered every man according to his eating.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHiishshidi eti litiruwan makkido wode, darissidi shiishshidaagau palahibeenna; guuttaa shiishshidaagau paccibeenna; ubbaikka huuphiyan huuphiyan bau miyoogaa keenaa shiishshiis.

English Sentences: And Moses said, Let no man leave of it till the morning.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan Muusee eta, "Ooninne appe wonttossi ashshoppo" yaagiis.

English Sentences: Notwithstanding they hearkened not unto Moses; but some of them left of it until the morning, and it bred worms, and stank: and Moses was wroth with them.
Wolaitta Sentences: Gidikkonne etappe issooti issooti Muusee yootiyoogaa ekkennan aggidi, attaa maallado gakkanau wottidosona; wottidoogee guxunidi xinqqiis. Hegaa gishshau, Muusee eta hanqqettiis.

English Sentences: And they gathered it every morning, every man according to his eating: and when the sun waxed hot, it melted.
Wolaitta Sentences: Maallado maallado asai ubbai baayyo koshshiyaagaa shiishshiis; awai michchiyo wode sa7an attidaagee seeri aggiis.

English Sentences: And it came to pass, that on the sixth day they gathered twice as much bread, two omers for one man: and all the rulers of the congregation came and told Moses.
Wolaitta Sentences: Usuppuntta gallassan eti kaseegau naa77u kushiyaa shiishshoosona; issi issi asau oiddu litiro keenaa giyoogaa. Yaatin maabaraa halaqati yiidi hegaa Muuseyyo yootidosona.

English Sentences: And he said unto them, This is that which the LORD hath said, To morrow is the rest of the holy sabbath unto the LORD: bake that which ye will bake to day, and seethe that ye will seethe; and that which remaineth over lay up for you to be kept until the morning.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yootin i eta, "GODAI azazidoogee hagaa; wonttoi shemppo gallassa, GODAASSI geeshsha Sambbata. Hegaa gishshau, intte uukkiyoobaa uukkite; intte doissiyoobaanne doissite; palahidaagaa wonttossi ashshite" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And they laid it up till the morning, as Moses bade: and it did not stink, neither was there any worm therein.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau, eti Muusee azazidoogaadan wonttossi wottidosona; wottin xinqqibeenna woikko guxunibeenna.

English Sentences: And Moses said, Eat that to day; for to day is a sabbath unto the LORD: to day ye shall not find it in the field.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Hachchi miite; aissi giikko, hachchi GODAA Sambbata; intte a hachchi dembban demmekketa.

English Sentences: Six days ye shall gather it; but on the seventh day, which is the sabbath, in it there shall be none.
Wolaitta Sentences: Intte usuppun gallassan a shiishshanau danddayeeta; shin laappuntta gallassai Sambbata. Sambbatan aibinne de7enna" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And it came to pass, that there went out some of the people on the seventh day for to gather, and they found none.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaaginkka laappuntta gallassan issi issi asai shiishshanau kiyiis; shin eti ainne demmibookkona.

English Sentences: And the LORD said unto Moses, How long refuse ye to keep my commandments and my laws?
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAI Muusa, "Ta azazotanne ta higgeta naagiyoogaa aude gakkanaassi ixxuuteetii?

English Sentences: See, for that the LORD hath given you the sabbath, therefore he giveth you on the sixth day the bread of two days; abide ye every man in his place, let no man go out of his place on the seventh day.
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAI intteyyo Sambbataa immidoogaa akeekite; usuppuntta gallassan i intteyyo naa77u gallassa oittaa immiyoogee hegaa gishshaassa. Laappuntta gallassi ubbai ba de7iyoosan de7iyoosan takko; ooninne kare kiyoppo" yaagiis.

English Sentences: So the people rested on the seventh day.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau, asai laappuntta gallassan shemppiis.

English Sentences: And the house of Israel called the name thereof Manna: and it was like coriander seed, white; and the taste of it was like wafers made with honey.
Wolaitta Sentences: Israa7eela asai he oittaa mannaa giidi sunttiis. Mannai deebbo aifedan bootta; eessaara uukkido lichchakkodan mal77ees.

English Sentences: And Moses said, This is the thing which the LORD commandeth, Fill an omer of it to be kept for your generations; that they may see the bread wherewith I have fed you in the wilderness, when I brought you forth from the land of Egypt.
Wolaitta Sentences: Muusee Israa7eela asaa, "GODAI azazidobai hagaa; Taani inttena Gibxxe biittaappe kessido wode, bazzon mizido oittaa eti be7ana mala, mannaappe naa77u xaasa gidiyaagaa intte yaana yeletaassi ashshi wottite yaagidi azaziis" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And Moses said unto Aaron, Take a pot, and put an omer full of manna therein, and lay it up before the LORD, to be kept for your generations.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin Muusee Aaroona, "Issi xaaro ekkada naa77u litiro kumetta mannaa an qola; yaatada yaana yeletaassi minjjettana mala, GODAA sinttan wotta" yaagiis.

English Sentences: As the LORD commanded Moses, so Aaron laid it up before the Testimony, to be kept.
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAI Muusa azazidoogaadan minjjettana mala, Aarooni mannaa GODAA sinttan wottiis.

English Sentences: And the children of Israel did eat manna forty years, until they came to a land inhabited; they did eat manna, until they came unto the borders of the land of Canaan.
Wolaitta Sentences: Israa7eelati bantta de7iyo biittaa yaana gakkanaassi oitamu laittaa mannaa miidosona; eti Kanaane biittaa zawaa gakkana gakkanaassi mannaa miiddi de7idosona.

English Sentences: Now an omer is the tenth part of an ephah.
Wolaitta Sentences: He wode asai makkiyo erettida miishshai laatamanne naa77u litiro oiqqees.

English Sentences: And all the congregation of the children of Israel journeyed from the wilderness of Sin, after their journeys, according to the commandment of the LORD, and pitched in Rephidim: and there was no water for the people to drink.
Wolaitta Sentences: Israa7eelatu maabara ubbai GODAI azazidoogaadan, issi sohuwaappe hara sohuwaa yuuyiiddi, Siinaa Bazzuwaappe denddidi biidi, Rafiidima giyo sohuwan uttidosona. SHin asai uyanau haatti he sohuwan xayiis.

English Sentences: Wherefore the people did chide with Moses, and said, Give us water that we may drink. And Moses said unto them, Why chide ye with me? wherefore do ye tempt the LORD?
Wolaitta Sentences: Xayin eti Muuseera ooyettidi a, "Nuuyyo uyanau haatta imma" yaagidosona. Yaagin Muusee zaaridi, "Intte tanaara aissi ooyetteetii? GODAA intte aissi paacceetii?" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And the people thirsted there for water; and the people murmured against Moses, and said, Wherefore is this that thou hast brought us up out of Egypt, to kill us and our children and our cattle with thirst?
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin asai yan haattaa saamettidi, Muuse bolli zuuzummidosona. Eti a, "Neeni nuna, nu naatanne nu mehiyaa saamuwan woranau Gibxxeppe kessada pude aissi ehaadii?" yaagidi Muuse bollan zuuzummidosona.

English Sentences: And Moses cried unto the LORD, saying, What shall I do unto this people? they be almost ready to stone me.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaanin Muusee, "Taani ha asaa waatoo? Eti tana shuchchan caddana hanoosona" yaagidi GODAAKKO waassiis.

English Sentences: And the LORD said unto Moses, Go on before the people, and take with thee of the elders of Israel; and thy rod, wherewith thou smotest the river, take in thine hand, and go.
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAI Muusa, "Neeni asaappe sinttau hemetta; Israa7eela asaa cimatuppe nenaara efa; ini neeni Naile SHaafaa haattaa shocido gatimaa ne kushiyan oiqqada ba.

English Sentences: Behold, I will stand before thee there upon the rock in Horeb; and thou shalt smite the rock, and there shall come water out of it, that the people may drink. And Moses did so in the sight of the elders of Israel.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani Siinaa Deriyaa zaallaa bolli ne sinttan eqqana; neeni he zaallaa shoca; asai uyanau appe haattai kiyana" yaagiis. Muusee Israa7eela cimatu sinttan hegaadan oottiis.

English Sentences: And he called the name of the place Massah, and Meribah, because of the chiding of the children of Israel, and because they tempted the LORD, saying, Is the LORD among us, or not?
Wolaitta Sentences: Israa7eelati, "GODAI nu giddon de7iiyye de7ennee?" yaagidi ooyettido gishshaunne GODAA paaccido gishshau, he sohuwaa Masaahanne Mariiba giidi sunttiis.

English Sentences: Then came Amalek, and fought with Israel in Rephidim.
Wolaitta Sentences: Amaaleeqati yiidi, Rafiidiman Israa7eelatuura olaa gaittidosona.

English Sentences: And Moses said unto Joshua, Choose us out men, and go out, fight with Amalek: to morrow I will stand on the top of the hill with the rod of God in mine hand.
Wolaitta Sentences: Muusee Yaasa, "Neeni nuuyyo asaa doorada, kiyada Amaaleeqatuura oletta; taani wontto Xoossaa gatimaa oiqqada, keraa huuphiyan eqqana" yaagiis.

English Sentences: So Joshua did as Moses had said to him, and fought with Amalek: and Moses, Aaron, and Hur went up to the top of the hill.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin Yaasu Muusee giidoogaadan, Amaaleeqatuura olettiis. Muusee, Aarooninne Huuri keraayyo huuphiyaa kiyidosona.

English Sentences: And it came to pass, when Moses held up his hand, that Israel prevailed: and when he let down his hand, Amalek prevailed.
Wolaitta Sentences: Muusee ba kushiyaa dentti gam77ido keenan ubban Israa7eelati xoonoosona; shin i ba kushiyaa ziqqissido wode Amaaleeqati xoonoosona.

English Sentences: But Moses' hands were heavy; and they took a stone, and put it under him, and he sat thereon; and Aaron and Hur stayed up his hands, the one on the one side, and the other on the other side; and his hands were steady until the going down of the sun.
Wolaitta Sentences: Muuse kushee arggaacido wode, eti shuchchaa ekki ehiidi, Muusa a bolli utissidosona. Aarooninne Huuri issoi issi baggaara issoi hinkko baggaara gididi, a kushiyaa sitti oottidi oiqqidosona. Yaatin awai wullana gakkanaassi a kushee sitti giidi takkiis.

English Sentences: And Joshua discomfited Amalek and his people with the edge of the sword.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau, Yaasu Amaaleeqatu olanchchata bisuwan xooniis.

English Sentences: And the LORD said unto Moses, Write this for a memorial in a book, and rehearse it in the ears of Joshua: for I will utterly put out the remembrance of Amalek from under heaven.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe simmin, Muusa GODAI hagaadan yaagiis; "Hagee ubbaton hassayettana mala hagaa xaafa. Yaatada Yaasa sissennan aggoppa; aissi giikko, saloppe garssan taani Amaaleeqa asata ciraara xaissana" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And Moses built an altar, and called the name of it Jehovahnissi:
Wolaitta Sentences: Muusee yarshshuwaa yarshshiyoosaa keexxidi, "GODAI ta Banddiraa" giidi sunttiis.

English Sentences: For he said, Because the LORD hath sworn that the LORD will have war with Amalek from generation to generation.
Wolaitta Sentences: I hagaadan yaagiis; "Kusheti pude GODAA kawotaa araataakko denddidosona; yeletaappe yeletaa gakkanaashinkka GODAI Amaaleeqatuura olettana" yaagiis.

English Sentences: When Jethro, the priest of Midian, Moses' father in law, heard of all that God had done for Moses, and for Israel his people, and that the LORD had brought Israel out of Egypt;
Wolaitta Sentences: Midiyaama biittaa qeesee, Muuse bolloi Yatiroi, GODAI Muuseyyoonne a asaa Israa7eelayyo oottidobaa ubbaanne GODAI Israa7eela Gibxxeppe kessidobaa siyiis.

English Sentences: Then Jethro, Moses' father in law, took Zipporah, Moses' wife, after he had sent her back,
Wolaitta Sentences: He wode Muuse bolloi, Yatiroi, Muusee yeggidi biido a keettaayyiyo Xippaaronne i naa77u naata ehiis.

English Sentences: And her two sons; of which the name of the one was Gershom; for he said, I have been an alien in a strange land:
Wolaitta Sentences: Etappe issuwaa sunttai Gershshooma; aissi giikko, Muusee, "Taani asa biittan bete gidaas" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And the name of the other was Eliezer; for the God of my father, said he, was mine help, and delivered me from the sword of Pharaoh:
Wolaitta Sentences: Naa77anttuwaa sunttai El77aazara; aissi giikko, i, "Ta aawaa Xoossai tana maaddidaagaa; i tana Gibxxe kawuwaa bisuwaappe ashshiis" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And Jethro, Moses' father in law, came with his sons and his wife unto Moses into the wilderness, where he encamped at the mount of God:
Wolaitta Sentences: Muuse bolloi Yatiroi a attuma naatuuranne a keettaayeera Xoossaa deriyaa matan de7iya Muusekko yiis.

English Sentences: And he said unto Moses, I thy father in law Jethro am come unto thee, and thy wife, and her two sons with her.
Wolaitta Sentences: I Muusa, "Taani, ne bolloi Yatiroi, ne keettaayeeranne i naa77u naatuura neekko yais" yaagidi akko kiitti wottiis.

English Sentences: And Moses went out to meet his father in law, and did obeisance, and kissed him; and they asked each other of their welfare; and they came into the tent.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau, Muusee ba bolluwaara gaittanau kiyidi, ayyo ziggidi a yeriis. Eti issoi issuwaa sarotidi, dunkkaane giddo gelidosona.

English Sentences: And Moses told his father in law all that the LORD had done unto Pharaoh and to the Egyptians for Israel's sake, and all the travail that had come upon them by the way, and how the LORD delivered them.
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAI Israa7eela asaa gishshau, kawuwaa bollinne Gibxxetu bolli oottido ubbaa, ogiyan eta gakkida daafuraabaa ubbaanne GODAI eta ashshidobaa Muusee ba bolluwaayyo yootiis.

English Sentences: And Jethro rejoiced for all the goodness which the LORD had done to Israel, whom he had delivered out of the hand of the Egyptians.
Wolaitta Sentences: Israa7eela asaa Gibxxetu kushiyaappe ashshanau GODAI oottido lo77o oosotubaa siyidi, Yatiroi ufaittiis.

English Sentences: And Jethro said, Blessed be the LORD, who hath delivered you out of the hand of the Egyptians, and out of the hand of Pharaoh, who hath delivered the people from under the hand of the Egyptians.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ufaittidi, "Inttena Gibxxetu kushiyaappenne kawuwaa kushiyaappe ashshida GODAI, Gibxxetu kushiyaappe asaa kessi ekkidaagee, i galatetto.

English Sentences: Now I know that the LORD is greater than all gods: for in the thing wherein they dealt proudly he was above them.
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAI hara Xoossatuppe ubbaappe gooba gidiyoogaa taani ha77i erais; aissi giikko, i hagaa Israa7eela asaassi iitidaageetussi oottiis" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And Jethro, Moses' father in law, took a burnt offering and sacrifices for God: and Aaron came, and all the elders of Israel, to eat bread with Moses' father in law before God.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan Yatiroi, Muuse bolloi, xuuggiyo yarshshuwaanne hara yarshshota Xoossaayyo ehiis; Aarooninne Israa7eela cimati ubbai Xoossaa sinttan Muuse bolluwaara oittaa maanau yiidosona.

English Sentences: And it came to pass on the morrow, that Moses sat to judge the people: and the people stood by Moses from the morning unto the evening.
Wolaitta Sentences: Wonttetta gallassi Muusee asaayyo pirddanau uttiis; asai Muuse yuushuwan maalladoppe omarssi gakkanaassi eqqiis.

English Sentences: And when Moses' father in law saw all that he did to the people, he said, What is this thing that thou doest to the people? why sittest thou thyself alone, and all the people stand by thee from morning unto even?
Wolaitta Sentences: Muuse bolloi Muusee asaayyo oottiyoobaa ubbaa be7idi, "Neeni ha asaayyo oottiyoogee hagee aibee? Asai ubbai maalladoppe doommidi omarssi gakkanaassi ne yuushuwan eqqidaashin, neeni nerkka daannadan aissi utta bayadii?" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And Moses said unto his father in law, Because the people come unto me to enquire of God:
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin Muusee ba bolluwaa, "Asai Xoossaa sheniyaa oichchanau taakko yiyo gishshaassa.

English Sentences: When they have a matter, they come unto me; and I judge between one and another, and I do make them know the statutes of God, and his laws.
Wolaitta Sentences: Etayyo yohoi de7ikkokka taakko yoosona; taani issi uraa gidduwaaninne a shooruwaa gidduwan pirddais; Xoossaa awaajuwaanne higgiyaa eta erissais" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And Moses' father in law said unto him, The thing that thou doest is not good.
Wolaitta Sentences: Muuse bolloi, "Hagee neeni oottiyoobai lo77o gidenna.

English Sentences: Thou wilt surely wear away, both thou, and this people that is with thee: for this thing is too heavy for thee; thou art not able to perform it thyself alone.
Wolaitta Sentences: Neeninne nenaara de7iya asai daafura xalaalaa daafureeta; ha oosoi neeyyo keehi deexo; neeni hagaa nerkka oottanau danddayakka.

English Sentences: Hearken now unto my voice, I will give thee counsel, and God shall be with thee: Be thou for the people to God-ward, that thou mayest bring the causes unto God:
Wolaitta Sentences: Ane ha77i taani yootiyoogaa siya; taani nena zorana; Xoossai nenaara gido. Neeni ha asaa gishshaa Xoossaa sintti aadhdha; neeni eta yohuwaa Xoossaakko eha.

English Sentences: And thou shalt teach them ordinances and laws, and shalt shew them the way wherein they must walk, and the work that they must do.
Wolaitta Sentences: Awaajuwaanne higgiyaa eta neeni tamaarissa; eti de7ana maaraanne oottana oosuwaa ubbaa eta bessa.

English Sentences: Moreover thou shalt provide out of all the people able men, such as fear God, men of truth, hating covetousness; and place such over them, to be rulers of thousands, and rulers of hundreds, rulers of fifties, and rulers of tens:
