English Sentences: And till Moses had done speaking with them, he put a vail on his face.
Wolaitta Sentences: Muusee etau yootiyoogaa wurssido wode, ba som77uwaa naxalan kammiis.

English Sentences: But when Moses went in before the LORD to speak with him, he took the vail off, until he came out. And he came out, and spake unto the children of Israel that which he was commanded.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin Muusee GODAA sintti aara haasayanau geliyo wode audenne kiyana gakkanaashin, naxalaa ba som77uwaappe qaarirggees. Hegaappe kiyidi, GODAI azazidobaa Israa7eela asau yootees.

English Sentences: And the children of Israel saw the face of Moses, that the skin of Moses' face shone: and Moses put the vail upon his face again, until he went in to speak with him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yootiyo wode, eti a som77oi phooliyaagaa be7idosona. Hegaa gishshau, Muusee GODAARA haasayanau baana gakkanaashin, ba som77uwaa zaarettidikka naxalan kammees.

English Sentences: And Moses gathered all the congregation of the children of Israel together, and said unto them, These are the words which the LORD hath commanded, that ye should do them.
Wolaitta Sentences: Muusee Israa7eela asaa yaa7aa muliyaa shiishshidi hagaadan yaagiis; "Intte oottana mala, GODAI azazidobai hagaa:

English Sentences: Six days shall work be done, but on the seventh day there shall be to you an holy day, a sabbath of rest to the LORD: whosoever doeth work therein shall be put to death.
Wolaitta Sentences: Saaminttaa giddon usuppun gallassa xalaalan oosuwaa oottite; shin laappuntta gallassai intteyyo geeshsha gallassa; GODAAYYOOKKA shemppo Sambbata. He gallassi ai oosonne oottiya uri ooninne haiqqanau bessees.

English Sentences: Ye shall kindle no fire throughout your habitations upon the sabbath day.
Wolaitta Sentences: Sambbata gallassan intte son son tama eettoppite" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And Moses spake unto all the congregation of the children of Israel, saying, This is the thing which the LORD commanded, saying,
Wolaitta Sentences: Muusee Israa7eela maabarau muliyau hagaadan yaagiis; "GODAI hagaadan yaagidi azaziis:

English Sentences: Take ye from among you an offering unto the LORD: whosoever is of a willing heart, let him bring it, an offering of the LORD; gold, and silver, and brass,
Wolaitta Sentences: Intteyyo de7iyaabaappe GODAAYYO immiyoobaa ehiite; GODAAYYO immiyoobaa ehaanau koyiya ooninne worqqaa, biraa, nahaasiyaa,

English Sentences: And blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine linen, and goats' hair,
Wolaitta Sentences: salo milatiya qacinaa, ochchaa teeraa milatiya qacinaa, shololla zo7o qacinaanne liiqo liinuwaa, deeshshaa agoziyaa,

English Sentences: And rams' skins dyed red, and badgers' skins, and shittim wood,
Wolaitta Sentences: dorssa orggiyaa calaa zo7o qalamiyan yeggi kessidoogaa, irppaniyaa, guuganttaa,

English Sentences: And oil for the light, and spices for anointing oil, and for the sweet incense,
Wolaitta Sentences: xomppiyaassi wogaraa zaitiyaa, tiyettiyo zaitiyaanne ixaanaa sawettiya qimamiyaa;

English Sentences: And onyx stones, and stones to be set for the ephod, and for the breastplate.
Wolaitta Sentences: eefuudiyaaninne tiran wottiyoogan yeggiyo maragidiyaa geetettiya shuchchatanne hara phooliya al77o shuchchata eho.

English Sentences: And every wise hearted among you shall come, and make all that the LORD hath commanded;
Wolaitta Sentences: "Intte giddon de7iya kushe hiilla eranchcha ubbati yiidi, GODAI azazido ubbaa oottona:

English Sentences: The tabernacle, his tent, and his covering, his taches, and his boards, his bars, his pillars, and his sockets,
Wolaitta Sentences: Xoossaa Dunkkaaniyaa, a kammiyo dunkkaaniyaanne a kammiyoogaa, qapheta, xagaageta, hiraqota, tuussatanne eti eqqiyo gedeta,

English Sentences: The ark, and the staves thereof, with the mercy seat, and the vail of the covering,
Wolaitta Sentences: Taabootaanne a tookkiyo kasota, atto giyo sohuwaa qum77uwaanne Taabootaa genttiyo magalashuwaa;

English Sentences: The table, and his staves, and all his vessels, and the shewbread,
Wolaitta Sentences: xaraphpheezaanne a tookkiyo kasota, a miishshata ubbaanne GODAA sinttan wottiyo geeshsha oittaa;

English Sentences: The candlestick also for the light, and his furniture, and his lamps, with the oil for the light,
Wolaitta Sentences: xomppiyaa wottiyo ballaanne an maaraara de7iya xomppeta, miishshata, xomppiyaa zaitiyaa,

English Sentences: And the incense altar, and his staves, and the anointing oil, and the sweet incense, and the hanging for the door at the entering in of the tabernacle,
Wolaitta Sentences: ixaanaa cuwayiyo saaxiniyaanne a tookkiyo kasota, tiyettiyo zaitiyaanne sawiya ixaanaa, Xoossaa Dunkkaaniyaa penggiyaa magalashuwaa;

English Sentences: The altar of burnt offering, with his brasen grate, his staves, and all his vessels, the laver and his foot,
Wolaitta Sentences: xuuggiyo yarshshuwaa yarshshiyoosaanne a nahaasiyaa zazzariyaa, a tookkiyo kasotanne a miishshata ubbaa, nahaasiyaappe oosettida meechcha keriyaanne a wottiyoogaa;

English Sentences: The hangings of the court, his pillars, and their sockets, and the hanging for the door of the court,
Wolaitta Sentences: so dabaabaa godaa magalashota, tuussatanne eta gedeta, dabaabaa soo giddo geliyo penggiyaa magalashuwaa;

English Sentences: The pins of the tabernacle, and the pins of the court, and their cords,
Wolaitta Sentences: Xoossaa Dunkkaaniyaa toliyo xisheta, dabaabaa giddo xishetanne eta wodorota;

English Sentences: The cloths of service, to do service in the holy place, the holy garments for Aaron the priest, and the garments of his sons, to minister in the priest's office.
Wolaitta Sentences: qeeseti Geeshsha Sohuwan oottiiddi maayanau dadettida maayota, qeesee Aarooninne a naati qeesetettaa oosuwaa oottiiddi maayiyo maayota oottona" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And all the congregation of the children of Israel departed from the presence of Moses.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan Israa7eela maabarai ubbai Muuse sinttappe kiyiis.

English Sentences: And they came, every one whose heart stirred him up, and every one whom his spirit made willing, and they brought the LORD's offering to the work of the tabernacle of the congregation, and for all his service, and for the holy garments.
Wolaitta Sentences: Kiyidi immanau koyidaageetinne eta wozanai eta imma imma giidoogeeti ubbai yiidosona; yiidi Xoossaa Dunkkaaniyaassi, a giddon oottiyo ooso ubbaunne geeshsha maayuwau koshshiyaabaa ubbaa ehiidosona.

English Sentences: And they came, both men and women, as many as were willing hearted, and brought bracelets, and earrings, and rings, and tablets, all jewels of gold: and every man that offered offered an offering of gold unto the LORD.
Wolaitta Sentences: Immana koyida attuma ubbainne macca ubbai yiidi, worqqaappe medhdhido alleeqota, haittaa gutichchata, migidota, qooriyan aattiyo gujjumatanne worqqaa alleeqota ehiidosona; ehiidi GODAASSI imo oottidi immidosona.

English Sentences: And every man, with whom was found blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine linen, and goats' hair, and red skins of rams, and badgers' skins, brought them.
Wolaitta Sentences: Salo milatiya qacinai, ochcha teera milatiya qacinai, shololla zo7o qacinai, woikko liinuwaa giyo liiqo qacinai, woikko deeshshaa agozee, dorssa orggiyaa calaa zo7o qalamiyan yeggi kessidoogee, woikko irppanee de7iyo asai ubbai ekkidi ehiis.

English Sentences: Every one that did offer an offering of silver and brass brought the LORD's offering: and every man, with whom was found shittim wood for any work of the service, brought it.
Wolaitta Sentences: Biraa woikko nahaasiyaa immanau danddayiya ubbai bantta imuwaa GODAAYYO immidosona; qassi guuganttai de7iyo asai ubbai dumma dumma oosuwau guuganttaa ehiis.

English Sentences: And all the women that were wise hearted did spin with their hands, and brought that which they had spun, both of blue, and of purple, and of scarlet, and of fine linen.
Wolaitta Sentences: Kushe hiillaa eriya maccaasai ubbai bantta kushiyan suqqido salo milatiya qacinaa, ochchaa teeraa milatiya qacinaa, shololla zo7o qacinaanne liiqo liinuwaa ehiidosona.

English Sentences: And all the women whose heart stirred them up in wisdom spun goats' hair.
Wolaitta Sentences: Qassikka imuwaa immanau koyida maccaasai ubbai deeshshaa agoziyaa daddidosona.

English Sentences: And the rulers brought onyx stones, and stones to be set, for the ephod, and for the breastplate;
Wolaitta Sentences: Halaqati eefuudiyaaninne tiran wottiyoogan wottiyo maragidiyaanne hara bonchchettida shuchchata ehiidosona.

English Sentences: And spice, and oil for the light, and for the anointing oil, and for the sweet incense.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti qassikka xomppiyaayyo, sawiya ixaanaayyoonne tishshaassi haniya wogaraa zaitiyaanne qimamiyaa ehiidosona.

English Sentences: The children of Israel brought a willing offering unto the LORD, every man and woman, whose heart made them willing to bring for all manner of work, which the LORD had commanded to be made by the hand of Moses.
Wolaitta Sentences: Israa7eelati asai ubbai, attumainne maccai, eti oottanaadan GODAI Muuse baggaara azazido oosuwau haniya imuwaa ubbaa bantta dosan GODAYYO ehiidosona.

English Sentences: And Moses said unto the children of Israel, See, the LORD hath called by name Bezaleel the son of Uri, the son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah;
Wolaitta Sentences: Muusee Israa7eela asaa hagaadan yaagiis; "Be7ite; GODAI Yihudaa zariyaappe Huura na7aa na7aa, Uura na7aa, Baxaali7eela dooriis.

English Sentences: And he hath filled him with the spirit of God, in wisdom, in understanding, and in knowledge, and in all manner of workmanship;
Wolaitta Sentences: Dooridi GODAI a Xoossaa Ayyaanan, hiillan, akeekaaninne ooso ubbaa oottiyo eran kunttiis.

English Sentences: And to devise curious works, to work in gold, and in silver, and in brass,
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegeekka hiillan oosuwaa halchchuwaa kessidi, worqqaappe, biraappenne nahaasiyaappe dumma dummabaa i oottanaassa.

English Sentences: And in the cutting of stones, to set them, and in carving of wood, to make any manner of cunning work.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaadankka, al77o shuchchaa massidi giigissanaassa; mittaa massanaassanne ubba qommo oosuwaa hiillan oottanaassa.

English Sentences: And he hath put in his heart that he may teach, both he, and Aholiab, the son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa bollikka qassi ayyoonne Daana zariyaa Ahisamaaka na7aa Oholi7aabayyo, hara asaa tamaarissiyo eratettaa immiis.

English Sentences: Them hath he filled with wisdom of heart, to work all manner of work, of the engraver, and of the cunning workman, and of the embroiderer, in blue, and in purple, in scarlet, and in fine linen, and of the weaver, even of them that do any work, and of those that devise cunning work.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti ubba qommo ooso oottanaadan, hiillan oottiyaageeta, oosuwaa halchchuwaa kessiyaageeta, salo milatiya qacinan, ochchaa teeraa milatiya qacinan, shololla zo7o qacinaaninne liinuwaa qacinan alleequwaa daddiyaageetanne shimainneta gidanaadan, GODAI eta eratettan kunttiis. Eti ubbaikka ubba qommo oosuwaa luxidi eriya eranchcha gididosona.

English Sentences: Then wrought Bezaleel and Aholiab, and every wise hearted man, in whom the LORD put wisdom and understanding to know how to work all manner of work for the service of the sanctuary, according to all that the LORD had commanded.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Hegaa gishshau, Baxaali7eeli, Oholi7aabinne Xoossaa Dunkkaaniyaa keexxana mala GODAI eraa immin, luxida asai ubbai GODAI azazidoogaadan ubbabaa oottana" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And Moses called Bezaleel and Aholiab, and every wise hearted man, in whose heart the LORD had put wisdom, even every one whose heart stirred him up to come unto the work to do it:
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan Muusee Baxaali7eela, Oholi7aabanne GODAI dumma eratettaa immidoogeeta oosuwaa oottanau yaana koyiya ubbaa xeesidi shiishshiis.

English Sentences: And they received of Moses all the offering, which the children of Israel had brought for the work of the service of the sanctuary, to make it withal. And they brought yet unto him free offerings every morning.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHiiqidaageeti Israa7eela asai Xoossaa Dunkkaaniyaa oottanau ehiido imo ubbaa Muuseppe ekkidosona. Qassi asai ba dosan coo immiyo imotaa maallado maallado gujji gujjidi ehiyoogaa aggibeenna.

English Sentences: And all the wise men, that wrought all the work of the sanctuary, came every man from his work which they made;
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaatin Xoossaa Dunkkaaniyaa oottiya erai kumido asai ubbai bantta oosuwaa wottiishshidi,

English Sentences: And they spake unto Moses, saying, The people bring much more than enough for the service of the work, which the LORD commanded to make.
Wolaitta Sentences: Muusa hagaadan yaagidosona; "Asai GODAI azazido oosuwaayyo koshshiyaagaappe keehi dariyaagaa ehiiddi de7ees" yaagidosona.

English Sentences: And Moses gave commandment, and they caused it to be proclaimed throughout the camp, saying, Let neither man nor woman make any more work for the offering of the sanctuary. So the people were restrained from bringing.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin Muusee dunkkaanidosan de7iya asaassi hagaadan yaagidi azaziis; "Naa77antto ai attumaasikka ai maccaasikka Xoossaa Dunkkaaniyaa oosuwaassi immiyoobaa immanau ehooppo" yaagin, asai ehiyoogaa aggi bayiis.

English Sentences: For the stuff they had was sufficient for all the work to make it, and too much.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, eti ehiido imotai ooso ubbaa oottanau gididi palahees.

English Sentences: And every wise hearted man among them that wrought the work of the tabernacle made ten curtains of fine twined linen, and blue, and purple, and scarlet: with cherubims of cunning work made he them.
Wolaitta Sentences: Oosuwaa oottiyaageetu giddoppe hiillaa dariyaageeti ubbati liiqo liinuwaappenne salo milatiya, ochcha teeraa milatiyaanne shololla zo7o qacinaappe dadettida tammu magalashotuppe Xoossaa Dunkkaaniyaa giigissidosona. He magalashotu bolli bollaara issi hiillai kiruubetu misiliyaa sikkiis.

English Sentences: The length of one curtain was twenty and eight cubits, and the breadth of one curtain four cubits: the curtains were all of one size.
Wolaitta Sentences: Magalashoti ubbai issi likke gididi, geesai laatamanne hosppun wara; gomppai 4 wara.

English Sentences: And he coupled the five curtains one unto another: and the other five curtains he coupled one unto another.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ichchashu magalashota issippe gattidi sikkidosona; qassi hankko attida ichchashu magalashotakka etadan oottidosona.

English Sentences: And he made loops of blue on the edge of one curtain from the selvedge in the coupling: likewise he made in the uttermost side of another curtain, in the coupling of the second.
Wolaitta Sentences: Issippe gattidi sikkido magalashotuppe issi magalashuwaassi wurssetta gaxan salo milatiya carqqiyaappe siireta medhdhidosona. Qassi issippe gaitetti sikettida hankko magalashuwankka hegaadan oottidosona.

English Sentences: Fifty loops made he in one curtain, and fifty loops made he in the edge of the curtain which was in the coupling of the second: the loops held one curtain to another.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti issippe gaittida issi magalashuwaa bolli ishatamu siireta, qassi issippe gaittida hankko magalashuwaa bollikka ishatamu siireta medhdhidosona. He siireti ubbaikka issoi issuwaassi baazzan de7oosona.

English Sentences: And he made fifty taches of gold, and coupled the curtains one unto another with the taches: so it became one tabernacle.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan, worqqaappe ishatamu qapheta medhdhidosona. Medhdhidi Dunkkaanee issuwaa gidana mala, he magalashotu gaxaa gaxaa he qaphetun oittidosona.

English Sentences: And he made curtains of goats' hair for the tent over the tabernacle: eleven curtains he made them.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xoossaa Dunkkaaniyaa bollaara kammiyo dunkkaaniyaassi tammanne isiini magalashota deeshshaa agoziyaappe daddidosona.

English Sentences: The length of one curtain was thirty cubits, and four cubits was the breadth of one curtain: the eleven curtains were of one size.
Wolaitta Sentences: Tammanne isiini magalashotikka issi likke; issi issi magalashuwaa geesai hasttamu wara, gomppai oiddu wara.

English Sentences: And he coupled five curtains by themselves, and six curtains by themselves.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ichchashu magalashota issi baggaara, usuppun magalashota qassi hankko baggaara gattidi sikkidosona.

English Sentences: And he made fifty loops upon the uttermost edge of the curtain in the coupling, and fifty loops made he upon the edge of the curtain which coupleth the second.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan gatti sikkido magalashotuppe issi magalashuwaa gaxan ishatamu siireta medhdhidosona. Qassikka gatti sikkido hankko magalashotuppe wurssetta magalashuwaa gaxan ishatamu siireta medhdhidosona.

English Sentences: And he made fifty taches of brass to couple the tent together, that it might be one.
Wolaitta Sentences: Naa77u baggaara de7iya magalashota gattidi issi Dunkkaane oottanau nahaasiyaappe ishatamu qapheta medhdhidosona.

English Sentences: And he made a covering for the tent of rams' skins dyed red, and a covering of badgers' skins above that.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan dunkkaaniyaa kammanau dorssa orggiyaa calaa zo7o qalamiyan yeggi kessidoogaa giigissidosona; qassi a bollaara kammanau irppaniyaa giigissidosona.

English Sentences: And he made boards for the tabernacle of shittim wood, standing up.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xoossaa Dunkkaaniyaa xagaagiyoobata sitti giida guuganttaappe kessidosona.

English Sentences: The length of a board was ten cubits, and the breadth of a board one cubit and a half.
Wolaitta Sentences: Issi issi xagaagiyau geesai tammu wara; gomppai issi waranne bagga.

English Sentences: One board had two tenons, equally distant one from another: thus did he make for all the boards of the tabernacle.
Wolaitta Sentences: Issi issi xagaagiyaassi issuwaa issuwaara gatti oittiya naa77u marata medhdhidosona. Xoossaa Dunkkaaniyaa xagaageta ubbaakka hegaadan oottidosona.

English Sentences: And he made boards for the tabernacle; twenty boards for the south side southward:
Wolaitta Sentences: Xoossaa Dunkkaaniyaayyo tohossa baggaara laatamu xagaageta medhdhidosona.

English Sentences: And forty sockets of silver he made under the twenty boards; two sockets under one board for his two tenons, and two sockets under another board for his two tenons.
Wolaitta Sentences: Medhdhidi issi issi xagaagiyaayyo naa77u gedeta, muleera oitamu gedeta biraappe giigissidosona.

English Sentences: And for the other side of the tabernacle, which is toward the north corner, he made twenty boards,
Wolaitta Sentences: Xoossaa Dunkkaaniyaayyo huuphessa baggaara laatamu xagaageta medhdhidosona.

English Sentences: And their forty sockets of silver; two sockets under one board, and two sockets under another board.
Wolaitta Sentences: Medhdhidi issi issi xagaagiyaayyo naa77u gedeta, muleera oitamu gedeta biraappe giigissidosona.

English Sentences: And for the sides of the tabernacle westward he made six boards.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xoossaa Dunkkaaniyaayyo guyye gaxan arggo baggaara usuppun xagaageta medhdhidosona.

English Sentences: And two boards made he for the corners of the tabernacle in the two sides.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xoossaa Dunkkaaniyaa guyye gaxan de7iya zoozetuyyo naa77u xagaageta giigissidosona.

English Sentences: And they were coupled beneath, and coupled together at the head thereof, to one ring: thus he did to both of them in both the corners.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ha naa77u zoozetun de7iya xagaageti xaphuwaappe xeeraa gakkanaashin daabula gididi biidi, xeeran issi sagaayuwan geli oiqettidosona. Eti naa77aikka hegaadan hanidosona.

English Sentences: And there were eight boards; and their sockets were sixteen sockets of silver, under every board two sockets.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau, issi issi xagaagiyaayyo garssaara naa77u naa77u gedeti de7oosona; muleera hosppun xagaagetinne biraappe oosettida tammanne usuppun gedeti de7oosona.

English Sentences: And he made bars of shittim wood; five for the boards of the one side of the tabernacle,
Wolaitta Sentences: Qassi eti guuganttaappe hiraqota kessidosona; Xoossaa Dunkkaaniyaayyo issi bagga miyyiyan de7iya xagaagetuyyo ichchashu hiraqota,

English Sentences: And five bars for the boards of the other side of the tabernacle, and five bars for the boards of the tabernacle for the sides westward.
Wolaitta Sentences: qassi hankko bagga miyyiyan de7iya xagaagetussi ichchashu hiraqota giigissidosona. Hegaadankka, Xoossaa Dunkkaaniyaayyo guyye arggo baggaara wurssetta gaxan de7iya xagaagetuyyo ichchashu hiraqota medhdhidosona.

English Sentences: And he made the middle bar to shoot through the boards from the one end to the other.
Wolaitta Sentences: Giddo hiraqoi xagaagetussi giddo ginaara, ha gaxaappe ya gaxaa gakkanau kantti kiyanaadan oottidosona.

English Sentences: And he overlaid the boards with gold, and made their rings of gold to be places for the bars, and overlaid the bars with gold.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xagaageta worqqan sheeshshidi, hiraqoti aadhdhiyo sagaayota worqqaappe medhdhidosona; qassi hiraqotakka worqqan sheeshshidosona.

English Sentences: And he made a vail of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen: with cherubims made he it of cunning work.
Wolaitta Sentences: Salo milatiya, ochcha teera milatiyaanne, shololla zo7o qacinaappenne liiqo liinuwaappe issi magalashuwaa oottidosona. He magalashuwaa bolli issi hiillai kiruubetu misiliyaa sikkiis.

English Sentences: And he made thereunto four pillars of shittim wood, and overlaid them with gold: their hooks were of gold; and he cast for them four sockets of silver.
Wolaitta Sentences: Magalashuwaayyo oiddu tuussata guuganttaappe giigissidi, worqqan sheeshshidosona. Yaatidi worqqa kaqqiyoogeeta etayyo giigissidosona. Qassi tuussata essiyo oiddu gedeta biraappe medhdhidosona.

English Sentences: And he made an hanging for the tabernacle door of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen, of needlework;
Wolaitta Sentences: Xoossaa Dunkkaaniyaa geliyo penggiyaassi salo milatiya, ochcha teeraa milatiyaanne shololla zo7o qacinaappenne liiqo liinuwaappe dadettidaagaa, xilppiyaa alleeqissiyaagan magalashuwaa giigissidosona.

English Sentences: And the five pillars of it with their hooks: and he overlaid their chapiters and their fillets with gold: but their five sockets were of brass.
Wolaitta Sentences: Qassi eta kaqqiyo ichchashu tuussata, kaqqiyo ballaara de7iyaageeta medhdhidosona. Tuussatu gumbbotanne qachchiyoogeeta worqqan sheeshshidosona. Qassi eta gedeta ichchashatakka nahaasiyaappe medhdhidosona.

English Sentences: And Bezaleel made the ark of shittim wood: two cubits and a half was the length of it, and a cubit and a half the breadth of it, and a cubit and a half the height of it:
Wolaitta Sentences: Baxaali7eeli guuganttaa mittaappe Taabootaa giigissiis. He Taabootai zananaa naa77u waranne baggaa aduqqees; gomppai issi waranne baggaa aakkees; geesaikka issi waranne baggaa xoqqees.

English Sentences: And he overlaid it with pure gold within and without, and made a crown of gold to it round about.
Wolaitta Sentences: He Taabootaa giigissidi, suwaanne kariyaa walahi bainna worqqan sheeshshiis; yuushuwaakka worqqa tigettan yuushshi aattiis.

English Sentences: And he cast for it four rings of gold, to be set by the four corners of it; even two rings upon the one side of it, and two rings upon the other side of it.
Wolaitta Sentences: Qassi oiddu worqqa sagaayota tigidi, Taabootaayyo oiddu gedetun, issi baggaara naa77u sagaayota, qassi hankko baggaara naa77u sagaayota aattiis.

English Sentences: And he made staves of shittim wood, and overlaid them with gold.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaatidi guuganttaappe kasota kessiis. Kessidi etakka worqqan sheeshshiis.

English Sentences: And he put the staves into the rings by the sides of the ark, to bear the ark.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taabootaa tookkanau, Taabootaa miyyiyan de7iya sagaayotun kasota aattiis.

English Sentences: And he made the mercy seat of pure gold: two cubits and a half was the length thereof, and one cubit and a half the breadth thereof.
Wolaitta Sentences: Walahi bainna worqqaappe naa77u waranne baggaa aduqqiya, issi waranne baggaa aakkiya atto giyo sohuwaa qum77uwaa medhdhiis.

English Sentences: And he made two cherubims of gold, beaten out of one piece made he them, on the two ends of the mercy seat;
Wolaitta Sentences: Qum77uwaayyo wurssetta naa77u bagga gaxan naa77u kiruubeta qoxettida worqqaappe medhdhiis.

English Sentences: One cherub on the end on this side, and another cherub on the other end on that side: out of the mercy seat made he the cherubims on the two ends thereof.
Wolaitta Sentences: Issi kiruubiyaa issi bagga gaxan, naa77antto kiruubiyaa hankko bagga gaxan, naa77aakka qum77uwaara gatti oittidi medhdhiis.

English Sentences: And the cherubims spread out their wings on high, and covered with their wings over the mercy seat, with their faces one to another; even to the mercy seatward were the faces of the cherubims.
Wolaitta Sentences: Kiruubeti bantta qefiyaa denttidi, atto giyo sohuwaa kammiyo qum77uwaa bantta qefiyan kuwayi wottidosona; qassi issoi issuwaakko simmi uttidi, qum77uwaa xeelloosona.

English Sentences: And he made the table of shittim wood: two cubits was the length thereof, and a cubit the breadth thereof, and a cubit and a half the height thereof:
Wolaitta Sentences: Qassi zananai naa77u wara, gomppai issi wara, geesaikka issi waranne bagga gidido xaraphpheezaa guuganttaappe medhdhiis.

English Sentences: And he overlaid it with pure gold, and made thereunto a crown of gold round about.
Wolaitta Sentences: Medhdhidi walahi bainna worqqan sheeshshiis. Yuushuwaakka worqqa tigettaa yuushshi aattiis.

English Sentences: Also he made thereunto a border of an handbreadth round about; and made a crown of gold for the border thereof round about.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaadankka, gomppai takkaaro gidiya shaashiyaa a bolli yuushshi aattiis. Yaatidi a bolli worqqaa tigettaa yuushshiis.

English Sentences: And he cast for it four rings of gold, and put the rings upon the four corners that were in the four feet thereof.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaatidi Taabootaa tookkanau giigiya oiddu worqqa sagaayota medhdhiis; medhdhidi oiddu gedeti merettido oiddu zoozetuura oittiis.

English Sentences: Over against the border were the rings, the places for the staves to bear the table.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xaraphpheezaa tookkanau kasota aattiyo sagaayoti xaraphpheezau shaashiyaa lanqqiyan shiiqidi merettidosona.

English Sentences: And he made the staves of shittim wood, and overlaid them with gold, to bear the table.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xaraphpheezaa tookkiyo kasotakka guuganttaappe kessidi, worqqan sheeshshiis.

English Sentences: And he made the vessels which were upon the table, his dishes, and his spoons, and his bowls, and his covers to cover withal, of pure gold.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaadankka, xaraphpheezaa bolli wottiyo dumma dumma miishshata walahi bainna worqqaappe medhdhiis; hegeetikka sainetanne cilppata, qassi ushshaa yarshshuwaa tigiyo keretanne xuu7ata.

English Sentences: And he made the candlestick of pure gold: of beaten work made he the candlestick; his shaft, and his branch, his bowls, his knops, and his flowers, were of the same:
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan Baxaali7eeli xomppiyaa wottiyo ballaa qoxettida walahi bainna worqqaappe medhdhiis; he ballaa essiyo gediyaakka, giddo toomaakka qoxxido worqqaappe medhdhiis. A qururuusota, a kukkumotanne a ciishshata ubbaa aara issippe oittidi medhdhiis.

English Sentences: And six branches going out of the sides thereof; three branches of the candlestick out of the one side thereof, and three branches of the candlestick out of the other side thereof:
Wolaitta Sentences: Miyyiyaara usuppun marata medhdhiis; marata heezzaa issi baggaara, qassi heezzaa hankko baggaara kessiis.

English Sentences: Three bowls made after the fashion of almonds in one branch, a knop and a flower; and three bowls made like almonds in another branch, a knop and a flower: so throughout the six branches going out of the candlestick.
Wolaitta Sentences: Usuppun maratussikka huuphiyan huuphiyan issi issi kukkumoinne ciishshati de7iyo lauziyaa ciishshaa milatiya wanccaa medhdhiis;

English Sentences: And in the candlestick were four bowls made like almonds, his knops, and his flowers:
Wolaitta Sentences: xomppiyaa wottiyo ballaassi giddo toomai, kukkumotinne ciishshati de7iyo lauziyaa ciishshaa milatiya oiddu wanccan alleeqetti uttiis.

English Sentences: And a knop under two branches of the same, and a knop under two branches of the same, and a knop under two branches of the same, according to the six branches going out of it.
Wolaitta Sentences: Naa77ai naa77ai issippe waattan de7iyo heezzu maratuppe garssaara issi issi kukkumoi meretti uttiis.

English Sentences: Their knops and their branches were of the same: all of it was one beaten work of pure gold.
Wolaitta Sentences: Kukkumotinne marati ubbai xomppiyaa wottiyo ballaara issippe oiqetti issuwaa gididi, walahi bainna worqqaappe qoxettidi merettidosona.

English Sentences: And he made his seven lamps, and his snuffers, and his snuffdishes, of pure gold.
Wolaitta Sentences: I qassi xomppiyaa wottiyo ballau laappun xomppeta, xomppiyaa toissiyo qaphetanne eta wottiyoobata walahi bainna worqqaappe medhdhiis.

English Sentences: Of a talent of pure gold made he it, and all the vessels thereof.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xomppiyaa wottiyo ballaanne an go7ettiyo miishshaa ubbaa medhdhanau hasttamanne ichchashu kilo giraame gidiya walahi bainna worqqaa wurssiis.

English Sentences: And he made the incense altar of shittim wood: the length of it was a cubit, and the breadth of it a cubit; it was foursquare; and two cubits was the height of it; the horns thereof were of the same.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaadankka, qassi ixaanaa cuwayiyo saaxiniyaa guuganttaappe medhdhiis. Ayyo oiddu zoozee de7ees; zananai issi wara; gomppai issi wara, geesai naa77u wara. A kacetikka aara issuwaa gididi oiqetti merettidaageeta.

English Sentences: And he overlaid it with pure gold, both the top of it, and the sides thereof round about, and the horns of it: also he made unto it a crown of gold round about.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ayyo bolla doonaa, oiddu miyye ubbaanne a kaceta walahi bainna worqqan sheeshshidi, a yuushuwaakka worqqaa tigettaa yuushshi aattiis.

English Sentences: And he made two rings of gold for it under the crown thereof, by the two corners of it, upon the two sides thereof, to be places for the staves to bear it withal.
Wolaitta Sentences: He worqqaa tigettaappe garssaara ixaanaa cuwayiyo saaxiniyaayyo worqqaappe naa77u sagaayota medhdhiis; yaatidi ya baggaaranne ha baggaara naa77aa naa77aa oittiis. Hegeeti tookkiyo wode kasota aattanau maaddanaassa.

English Sentences: And he made the staves of shittim wood, and overlaid them with gold.
Wolaitta Sentences: Kasota guuganttaappe kessidi, eta worqqan sheeshshiis.

English Sentences: And he made the holy anointing oil, and the pure incense of sweet spices, according to the work of the apothecary.
Wolaitta Sentences: Qassi geeshsha tiyettiyo zaitiyaanne sawuwaa tonggu giya lo77o ixaanaa shittuwaa oottiyo eran giigissiis.

English Sentences: And he made the altar of burnt offering of shittim wood: five cubits was the length thereof, and five cubits the breadth thereof; it was foursquare; and three cubits the height thereof.
Wolaitta Sentences: Guuganttaappe xuuggiyo yarshshuwaa yarshshiyoosaa keexxiis. He yarshshiyoosaayyo geesai heezzu wara, gomppainne zananai issi likke, ichchashu ichchashu wara gididi, oiddu zooziyaara de7iyaagaa oottidosona.

English Sentences: And he made the horns thereof on the four corners of it; the horns thereof were of the same: and he overlaid it with brass.
Wolaitta Sentences: Oiddu zoozetu wurssetta gaxan gaxan issi issi kaciyaa medhdhiis. He kaceti yarshshiyoosaara issippe oiqettidi oosettidosona. Yaatin yarshshiyoosaa nahaasiyaa biratan sheeshshiis.

English Sentences: And he made all the vessels of the altar, the pots, and the shovels, and the basons, and the fleshhooks, and the firepans: all the vessels thereof made he of brass.
Wolaitta Sentences: An go7ettiyo miishshata, balddeta, akaafata, araciyo kuixaarota, ashuwaa qaphiyo qaphetanne tama cooceta ubbaa nahaasiyaa birataappe medhdhiis.

English Sentences: And he made for the altar a brasen grate of network under the compass thereof beneath unto the midst of it.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaatidi nahaasiyaa birataappe zazzariyaa yarshshiyoosaassi giigissiis; giigissidi yarshshiyoosaayyo duge giddo ginan de7iya dacaa bolli wottiis.

English Sentences: And he cast four rings for the four ends of the grate of brass, to be places for the staves.
Wolaitta Sentences: Nahaasiyaa birataappe medhdhido zazzariyaayyo oiddu zooziyan kasota aattanau oiddu sagaayota medhdhiis.

English Sentences: And he made the staves of shittim wood, and overlaid them with brass.
Wolaitta Sentences: Guuganttaappe yarshshiyoosaayyo kasota kessidi, nahaasiyaa biratan sheeshshiis.

English Sentences: And he put the staves into the rings on the sides of the altar, to bear it withal; he made the altar hollow with boards.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yarshshiyoosaa tookkiyo wode maaddana mala, ha kasota naa77u miyyiyaara de7iya sagaayotun aattiis. Yarshshiyoosaa gidduwaa kofa kessidi, xaulaappe medhdhiis.

English Sentences: And he made the laver of brass, and the foot of it of brass, of the lookingglasses of the women assembling, which assembled at the door of the tabernacle of the congregation.
Wolaitta Sentences: Nahaasiyaa birataappe meechcha keriyaanne a wottiyoogaa medhdhiis; he biratai Xoossaa Dunkkaaniyaa penggen oottiya maccaasati ehiido heregaappe ekettiis.

English Sentences: And he made the court: on the south side southward the hangings of the court were of fine twined linen, an hundred cubits:
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan dabaabaa giigissiis. Dabaabaassi tohossa bagga zananaa xeetu wara oottidi, liiqo liinuwaappe dadettida magalashuwaa giigissiis.

English Sentences: Their pillars were twenty, and their brasen sockets twenty; the hooks of the pillars and their fillets were of silver.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ayyo nahaasiyaa birataappe laatamu tuussatanne tuussati eqqiyo nahaase gedeta oottiis; eta huuphiyan qassi biraappe merettida kaqqiyoogeetanne tuussata huuphiyan qachchiyoogeeta oottiis.

English Sentences: And for the north side the hangings were an hundred cubits, their pillars were twenty, and their sockets of brass twenty; the hooks of the pillars and their fillets of silver.
Wolaitta Sentences: Dabaabau huuphessa bagga zananai xeetu wara adussa; qassi laatamu tuussatinne he tuussatuyyo laatamu nahaasiyaa gedeti de7oosona. Yaatidi biraappe oosettida kaqqiyoogeetinne tuussatu huuphiyan qachchiyoogeeti de7oosona.

English Sentences: And for the west side were hangings of fifty cubits, their pillars ten, and their sockets ten; the hooks of the pillars and their fillets of silver.
Wolaitta Sentences: Arggo bagga dabaabaa gomppai ishatamu wara aaho gididi, tammu tuussatinne tuussatuyyo tammu gedeti de7iyo magalashota giigissiis; he tuussatu huuphiyan biraappe merettida kaqqiyoogeetanne tuussatu huuphiyan qachchiyoogeeta oottiis.

English Sentences: And for the east side eastward fifty cubits.
Wolaitta Sentences: Qassi arshsho bagga dabaabaa gomppai ishatamu wara aaho.

English Sentences: The hangings of the one side of the gate were fifteen cubits; their pillars three, and their sockets three.
Wolaitta Sentences: Dabaabaa geliyoosaappe issi baggaara tammanne ichchashu wara aduqqiya magalashoti, etayyo heezzu tuussatinne tuussatuyyo heezzu gedeti de7oosona.

English Sentences: And for the other side of the court gate, on this hand and that hand, were hangings of fifteen cubits; their pillars three, and their sockets three.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaadankka, dabaabaa geliyoosaappe hinkko baggaara, tammanne ichchashu wara aduqqiya magalashoti, etayyo heezzu tuussatinne tuussatuyyo heezzu gedeti de7oosona.

English Sentences: All the hangings of the court round about were of fine twined linen.
Wolaitta Sentences: Dabaabaa yuushuwan de7iya magalashoti ubbai liiqo liinuwaappe dadettidaageeta.

English Sentences: And the sockets for the pillars were of brass; the hooks of the pillars and their fillets of silver; and the overlaying of their chapiters of silver; and all the pillars of the court were filleted with silver.
Wolaitta Sentences: He tuussatu gedeti nahaasiyaappe, kaqqiyoogeetinne tuussatu huuphiyan qachchiyoogeeti biraappe oosettidosona; eta huuphee biran sheeshettiis. Hegaa gishshau, dabaabaa yuushuwan de7iya tuussatu ubbaa huuphiyan biraappe oosettida qachchiyoogeeti de7oosona.

English Sentences: And the hanging for the gate of the court was needlework, of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen: and twenty cubits was the length, and the height in the breadth was five cubits, answerable to the hangings of the court.
Wolaitta Sentences: Dabaabaa geliyoosan kaqqiyo magalashoi salo milatiya ochchaa teeraa milatiyaanne shololla zo7o qacinaappenne liiqo liinuwaappe daddiyoogaa xilppiyan alleeqissiyaagan giigissidoogaa. Ayyo zananai laatamu wara; geesai dabaabaa magalashotu likke, ichchashu wara.

English Sentences: And their pillars were four, and their sockets of brass four; their hooks of silver, and the overlaying of their chapiters and their fillets of silver.
Wolaitta Sentences: Nahaasiyaa birataappe oosettida oiddu tuussatinne tuussatussi oiddu gedeti de7oosona. Eta kaqqiyoogeetinne tuussatu huuphiyan qachchiyoogeeti biraappe oosettidosona; eta huuphetikka biran sheeshettidosona.

English Sentences: And all the pins of the tabernacle, and of the court round about, were of brass.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xoossaa Dunkkaaniyaa xisheti ubbainne a yuushuwan de7iya dabaabaa xisheti ubbai nahaasiyaa birataappe oosettidaageeta.

English Sentences: This is the sum of the tabernacle, even of the tabernacle of testimony, as it was counted, according to the commandment of Moses, for the service of the Levites, by the hand of Ithamar, son to Aaron the priest.
Wolaitta Sentences: Dunkkaaniyau, Maachchaa Dunkkaaniyau, go7ettido miishshata Leewati mazggaban xaafidosona. He miishshata qeesiyaa Aaroona na7aa Itaamaara halaqatettaa garssan de7iya Leewati mazggaban xaafanaadan Muusee azaziis.

English Sentences: And Bezaleel the son of Uri, the son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah, made all that the LORD commanded Moses.
Wolaitta Sentences: Biniyaama zare gidiya Hoora na7aa na7aa, Uura na7aa, Baxaali7eeli GODAI Muusa azazido ubbaa oottiis.

English Sentences: And with him was Aholiab, son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan, an engraver, and a cunning workman, and an embroiderer in blue, and in purple, and in scarlet, and fine linen.
Wolaitta Sentences: Daana zare gidida Ahisamaaka na7aa Oholi7aabi aara de7ees; i kushe hiillanchchanne oottiyoobaassi koiro halchchuwaa kessiyaagaa; qassi salo milatiya, ochchaa teeraa milatiyaanne shololla zo7o qacinaaninne liiqo liinuwan daddidi, xilppiyan alleeqissiya asa.

English Sentences: All the gold that was occupied for the work in all the work of the holy place, even the gold of the offering, was twenty and nine talents, and seven hundred and thirty shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xoossaa Dunkkaaniyaa oosuwaayyo GODAASSI imettida worqqai Xoossaa Dunkkaaniyan eriyo meezaanan wottin, issi sha7u kilo giraame deexxiis.

English Sentences: And the silver of them that were numbered of the congregation was an hundred talents, and a thousand seven hundred and threescore and fifteen shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary:
Wolaitta Sentences: Qoodan de7iya maabaraa asaappe beettida birai Xoossaa Dunkkaaniyan eriyo meezaanan wottin, 3,430 kilo giraame deexxiis.

English Sentences: A bekah for every man, that is, half a shekel, after the shekel of the sanctuary, for every one that went to be numbered, from twenty years old and upward, for six hundred thousand and three thousand and five hundred and fifty men.
Wolaitta Sentences: Asaa qoodiyo wode qoodettida attuma asai ubbai huuphiyan huuphiyan Xoossaa Dunkkaaniyan eriyo meezaanan wottin, usuppun giraame keenaa immiis. Qoodettida asai laatamu laitta kumidoogeenne laatamaappe bollaara de7iyaagee muleera 603,550.

English Sentences: And of the hundred talents of silver were cast the sockets of the sanctuary, and the sockets of the vail; an hundred sockets of the hundred talents, a talent for a socket.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xoossaa Dunkkaaniyaa magalashota essido xeetu gedeti 3,400 kilo giraame tigiyo biran oosettidosona. Hegeekka issi issi gediyaassi hasttamanne oiddu kilo giraame tigiyo bira.

English Sentences: And of the thousand seven hundred seventy and five shekels he made hooks for the pillars, and overlaid their chapiters, and filleted them.
Wolaitta Sentences: Attida hasttamu kilo giraame tigiyo biraa tuussatun kaqqiyoogeeta medhdhanau, tuussatu huuphiyan sheeshshanaunne eta huuphiyan qachchiyoogeeta medhdhanau go7ettidosona.

English Sentences: And the brass of the offering was seventy talents, and two thousand and four hundred shekels.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaadankka, asai GODAASSI ehiido nahaase biratai 2,425 kilo giraame.

English Sentences: And therewith he made the sockets to the door of the tabernacle of the congregation, and the brasen altar, and the brasen grate for it, and all the vessels of the altar,
Wolaitta Sentences: He nahaasiyaa birataappe Xoossaa Dunkkaaniyaa geliyoosan eqqiya tuussatu gedeti, nahaasiyaa yarshshiyoosaa giyo yarshshiyoosai, a giddon hiixxido nahaase zazzareenne a giddon go7ettiyo dumma dumma miishsha ubbai merettiis.

English Sentences: And the sockets of the court round about, and the sockets of the court gate, and all the pins of the tabernacle, and all the pins of the court round about.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaadankka, qassi dabaabaa yuushuwan de7iya dirssaanne geliyoosaa penggee eqqido gedeti, qassi Xoossaa Dunkkaaneenne a yuushuwan de7iya dabaabaa dirssai tolettido xisheti ubbai he nahaase birataappe merettidosona.

English Sentences: And of the blue, and purple, and scarlet, they made cloths of service, to do service in the holy place, and made the holy garments for Aaron; as the LORD commanded Moses.
Wolaitta Sentences: Qeeseti Xoossaa Dunkkaaniyan oottiyo wode maayana maayuwaa, salo milatiya, ochchaa teeraa milatiyaanne shololla zo7o qacinaappe daddidosona. Aarooni maayiyo qeesetettaa maayuwaakka GODAI Muusa azazidoogaadan oottidosona.

English Sentences: And he made the ephod of gold, blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen.
Wolaitta Sentences: Qassi eti eefuudiyaa, worqqaappe, salo milatiya, ochchaa teeraa milatiyaanne shololla zo7o qacinaappenne liiqo liinuwaappe daddidosona.

English Sentences: And they did beat the gold into thin plates, and cut it into wires, to work it in the blue, and in the purple, and in the scarlet, and in the fine linen, with cunning work.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti worqqaa qoxxidi, lee7iyan yeechchayidi, appe qaraari qaraaridi, qacina kessidosona. Yaatidi salo milatiya, ochchaa teeraa milatiyaanne shololla zo7o qacinaanne liiqo liinuwaa gattidi, kushe hiillanchchati daddidosona.

English Sentences: They made shoulderpieces for it, to couple it together: by the two edges was it coupled together.
Wolaitta Sentences: Naa77u baggai gaittidi issuwaa gidana mala, naa77u hashiyaa bolli gattidi oittiya carqqiyaa giigissidosona.

English Sentences: And the curious girdle of his ephod, that was upon it, was of the same, according to the work thereof; of gold, blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen; as the LORD commanded Moses.
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAI Muusa azazidoogaadan, hiillai alleeqissidi daddido danccoikka eefuudiyaa mala gididi, worqqaappe salo milatiya, ochchaa teeraa milatiyaanne shololla zo7o qacinaappenne liiqo liinuwaappe dadettiis.

English Sentences: And they wrought onyx stones inclosed in ouches of gold, graven, as signets are graven, with the names of the children of Israel.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti maragidiyaa giyo naa77u shuchchata giigissidi, worqqaappe medhdhido shuchchaa oiqqiyaagaa bolli maaraara wottidosona. Maatafaa bolli sunttaa woocidi xaafiyoogaadan, he shuchchatu bolli Israa7eeliyaa naatu sunttaa woocidi xaafidosona.

English Sentences: And he put them on the shoulders of the ephod, that they should be stones for a memorial to the children of Israel; as the LORD commanded Moses.
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAI Muusa azazidoogaadan, tammanne naa77u Israa7eela zareta hassayiyoobaa gidana mala, ha tammanne naa77u shuchchata eefuudiyaara oittido hashiyaa carqqiyan wottidosona.

English Sentences: And he made the breastplate of cunning work, like the work of the ephod; of gold, blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti tiran wottiyoogaa kushe hiillanchchan oottidosona. He tiran wottiyoogaa eefuudiyaa worqqaappe, daddidoogaadan, salo milatiya, ochchaa teeraa milatiyaanne shololla zo7o qacinaappenne liiqo liinuwaappe daddidosona.

English Sentences: It was foursquare; they made the breastplate double: a span was the length thereof, and a span the breadth thereof, being doubled.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ayyo oiddu zoozee de7ees; geesainne gomppai issi issi takkaaro; yaanidaagaa dakkoyidosona.

English Sentences: And they set in it four rows of stones: the first row was a sardius, a topaz, and a carbuncle: this was the first row.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan a bolli oiddu maaran al77o shuchchata wottidosona; koiro maaran wottido shuchchai, sarddiyoona, tophaaziyooniyaanne phooliya inqquwaa;

English Sentences: And the second row, an emerald, a sapphire, and a diamond.
Wolaitta Sentences: naa77antto maaran baluura, sampperiyaanne almmaaziyaa giyo al77o shuchchata;

English Sentences: And the third row, a ligure, an agate, and an amethyst.
Wolaitta Sentences: heezzantto maaran yaakinttiyaa, kelqqedooniyaanne ametesxxinoosiyaa;

English Sentences: And the fourth row, a beryl, an onyx, and a jasper: they were inclosed in ouches of gold in their inclosings.
Wolaitta Sentences: oiddantta maaran biralle, maragidiyaanne yasphphiidiyaa. Hegeeta ubbaa worqqaappe oosettida shuchchaa oiqqiyoogaa bolli wottidosona.

English Sentences: And the stones were according to the names of the children of Israel, twelve, according to their names, like the engravings of a signet, every one with his name, according to the twelve tribes.
Wolaitta Sentences: Israa7eela naatu sunttaa qoodaadan, shuchchatu qoodaikka tammanne naa77a; issoi issoi maatafaadan woocettidi, tammanne naa77u zaretu sunttai he shuchchatun xaafettiis.

English Sentences: And they made upon the breastplate chains at the ends, of wreathen work of pure gold.
Wolaitta Sentences: Tiran wottiyoogaayyo wodorodan dooqettida sanssalataa walahi bainna worqqaappe medhdhidosona.

English Sentences: And they made two ouches of gold, and two gold rings; and put the two rings in the two ends of the breastplate.
Wolaitta Sentences: Naa77u worqqaappe medhdhido shuchchaa oiqqiyaageeta oottidosona; yaatidi naa77u worqqa migidota medhdhidoogeeta, tiran wottiyoogaayyo qommo gaxa zoozetuura gattidi oisettidosona.

English Sentences: And they put the two wreathen chains of gold in the two rings on the ends of the breastplate.
Wolaitta Sentences: He naa77u worqqa sanssalatata tiran wottiyoogaayyo zoozetun de7iya migidotuura gatti oittidosona.

English Sentences: And the two ends of the two wreathen chains they fastened in the two ouches, and put them on the shoulderpieces of the ephod, before it.
Wolaitta Sentences: He sanssalatatuyyo hankko bagga xeeraa qassi eefuudiyaayyo sintta baggaara, hashiyaa carqqiyan de7iya shuchchaa oiqqiyoogeetuura gatti qachchidosona.

English Sentences: And they made two rings of gold, and put them on the two ends of the breastplate, upon the border of it, which was on the side of the ephod inward.
Wolaitta Sentences: Qassikka naa77u worqqa migidota medhdhidi, eefuudiyaappe kaallidi de7iya tiran wottiyoogaayyo so baggaara de7iya naa77u zoozetu xeeran aattidosona.

English Sentences: And they made two other golden rings, and put them on the two sides of the ephod underneath, toward the forepart of it, over against the other coupling thereof, above the curious girdle of the ephod.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaadankka, worqqaappe hara naa77u migidota medhdhidi, eefuudiyaayyo sintta baggaara, hashiyaa carqqiyaappe garssa baggaara eefuudiyaa xeessan qachchiyoogaappe qommoora, sihoi gaittosaa matan eta oittidosona.

English Sentences: And they did bind the breastplate by his rings unto the rings of the ephod with a lace of blue, that it might be above the curious girdle of the ephod, and that the breastplate might not be loosed from the ephod; as the LORD commanded Moses.
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAI Muusa azazidoogaadan, tiran wottiyoogan de7iya migidota eefuudiyan de7iya migidotuura gattidi, salo milatiya baqettan qachchidosona; qachchin tiran wottiyoogee xeessaappe qommoora de7iyo gishshau, qashoi dol77enna.

English Sentences: And he made the robe of the ephod of woven work, all of blue.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eefuudiyaappe bollaara maayiyo adussa maayuwaa eti muleera salo milatiya carqqiyaappe giigissidosona; hegee shimainne ooso.

English Sentences: And there was an hole in the midst of the robe, as the hole of an habergeon, with a band round about the hole, that it should not rend.
Wolaitta Sentences: He adussa maayuwaayyo qooriyaa aattiyoosaa medhdhidosona; he sohoi peerettennaadan, soo qalam77idi, yuushshi aattidi sikkidosona.

English Sentences: And they made upon the hems of the robe pomegranates of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and twined linen.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti adussa maayuwaa duge bagga macaraa yuushuwan salo milatiya, ochchaa teeraa milatiyaanne shololla zo7o qacinaappenne liiqo liinuwaappe roomaaniyaa teeraa misileta medhdhidosona.

English Sentences: And they made bells of pure gold, and put the bells between the pomegranates upon the hem of the robe, round about between the pomegranates;
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti qassi worqqaappe daalata medhdhidi, adussa maayuwau duge bagga gaxaa yuushshi aattidi, roomaane misiletu gidduwan, walahan aattidosona.

English Sentences: A bell and a pomegranate, a bell and a pomegranate, round about the hem of the robe to minister in; as the LORD commanded Moses.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti he maayuwaayyo duge bagga macaraa yuushshi aattidi, daalaanne roomaaniyaa teeraa misiliyaa walakkidi aattidosona. Hegee GODAI Muusa azazidoogaadan, eti Xoossaa Dunkkaaniyaa oosuwaa oottiiddi maayanaassa.

English Sentences: And they made coats of fine linen of woven work for Aaron, and for his sons,
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAI Muusa azazidoogaadan, eti Aaroonayyoonne a naatuyyo shimainnee daddido liiqo liinuwaappe qoleta giigissidosona.

English Sentences: And a mitre of fine linen, and goodly bonnets of fine linen, and linen breeches of fine twined linen,
Wolaitta Sentences: Qassi huuphiyan xaaxiyo shaasheta, qophetanne garssaara maayiyo maayota liiqo liinuwaappe daddidi giigissidosona.

English Sentences: And a girdle of fine twined linen, and blue, and purple, and scarlet, of needlework; as the LORD commanded Moses.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaadankka, qassi eti salo milatiya, ochchaa teeraa milatiyaanne shololla zo7o qacinaappenne liiqo liinuwaappe daddidi, kushe hiillan alleeqissidi, danccuwaa giigissidosona.

English Sentences: And they made the plate of the holy crown of pure gold, and wrote upon it a writing, like to the engravings of a signet, HOLINESS TO THE LORD.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti akiliiliyaa misiliyaa walahi bainna worqqaappe medhdhidi, maatafaa bolli woociyoogaadan, a bolli, GODAASSI GEESHSHA GIDIDI DUMMATIIS yaagiyaagaa woocidi xaafidosona.

English Sentences: And they tied unto it a lace of blue, to fasten it on high upon the mitre; as the LORD commanded Moses.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan huuphiyan shaashiya bolli kaqqanaadan, GODAI Muusa azazidoogaadan salo milatiya baqettaa an aattidi qachchidosona.

English Sentences: Thus was all the work of the tabernacle of the tent of the congregation finished: and the children of Israel did according to all that the LORD commanded Moses, so did they.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xoossaa Dunkkaaniyaa oosoi ubbai muleera polettiis. Israa7eelati ubbabaakka GODAI Muusa azazidoogaadan oottidosona.

English Sentences: And they brought the tabernacle unto Moses, the tent, and all his furniture, his taches, his boards, his bars, and his pillars, and his sockets,
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan eti Xoossaa Dunkkaaniyaa muleera ekkidi Muusekko ehiidosona; hegeekka: dunkkaaniyaanne a miishsha ubbaa, qapheta, xagaageta, hiraqota, tuussatanne eti eqqiyo gedeta,

English Sentences: And the covering of rams' skins dyed red, and the covering of badgers' skins, and the vail of the covering,
Wolaitta Sentences: bolla kamaassi dorssa orggiyaa calaa zo7o qalamiyan yeggi kessidoogaa, irppaniyaa, genttiyo magalashuwaa,

English Sentences: The ark of the testimony, and the staves thereof, and the mercy seat,
Wolaitta Sentences: Maachchaa Taabootaa, a tookkiyo kasotanne atto giyo sohuwaa qum77uwaa,

English Sentences: The table, and all the vessels thereof, and the shewbread,
Wolaitta Sentences: xaraphpheezaanne a miishshaa ubbaa GODAA sinttan wottiyo geeshsha oittaa,

English Sentences: The pure candlestick, with the lamps thereof, even with the lamps to be set in order, and all the vessels thereof, and the oil for light,
Wolaitta Sentences: walahi bainna worqqaappe oosettida xomppiyaa wottiyo ballaanne an maaran de7iya xomppeta, eta miishshata ubbaanne xomppiyaa zaitiyaa,

English Sentences: And the golden altar, and the anointing oil, and the sweet incense, and the hanging for the tabernacle door,
Wolaitta Sentences: ixaanaa cuwayiyo worqqa saaxiniyaa, tiyettiyo zaitiyaa, sawiya ixaanaa, Xoossaa Dunkkaaniyaa penggiyaa magalashuwaa,

English Sentences: The brasen altar, and his grate of brass, his staves, and all his vessels, the laver and his foot,
Wolaitta Sentences: nahaasiyaappe oottido yarshshiyoosaa, a nahaasiyaa zazzariyaara, a tookkiyo kasota, a miishshata ubbaa, meechcha keriyaanne a wottiyoogaa,

English Sentences: The hangings of the court, his pillars, and his sockets, and the hanging for the court gate, his cords, and his pins, and all the vessels of the service of the tabernacle, for the tent of the congregation,
Wolaitta Sentences: dabaabaa godaa gennttiyo magalashota, a tuussata, eti eqqiyo gedeta, dabaabaa geliyo penggetu magalashota, dabaabaa wodorotanne xisheta, Xoossaa Dunkkaaniyaayyo koshshiya miishshata ubbaa;

English Sentences: The cloths of service to do service in the holy place, and the holy garments for Aaron the priest, and his sons' garments, to minister in the priest's office.
Wolaitta Sentences: qeeseti Geeshsha sohuwan oottiidi maayanau dadettida maayota, Aarooninne a naati qeesetettaa oottiiddi maayiyo maayota.

English Sentences: According to all that the LORD commanded Moses, so the children of Israel made all the work.
Wolaitta Sentences: Israa7eelati ooso ubbaakka GODAI Muusa azazidoogaadan oottidosona.

English Sentences: And Moses did look upon all the work, and, behold, they had done it as the LORD had commanded, even so had they done it: and Moses blessed them.
Wolaitta Sentences: Oottin Muusee oosuwaa xomoosi xeellidi, eti GODAI azazidoogaadan oottidoogaa be7iis. Hegaa gishshau, Muusee eta anjjiis.

English Sentences: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan GODAI Muusa,

English Sentences: On the first day of the first month shalt thou set up the tabernacle of the tent of the congregation.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Koiro aginaayyo koiro gallassi, neeni Xoossaa Dunkkaaniyaa tola.

English Sentences: And thou shalt put therein the ark of the testimony, and cover the ark with the vail.
Wolaitta Sentences: Maachchaa Taabootaa a giddon wotta; wottada he Taabootaa magalashuwan kamma.

English Sentences: And thou shalt bring in the table, and set in order the things that are to be set in order upon it; and thou shalt bring in the candlestick, and light the lamps thereof.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xaraphpheezaa gelissada, a bolli wodhdhanau koshshiya miishshata ubbaa a bolli wotta. Yaatada xomppeta wottiyo ballaa soo gelissada, a bolli xomppeta wotta.

English Sentences: And thou shalt set the altar of gold for the incense before the ark of the testimony, and put the hanging of the door to the tabernacle.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ixaanaa cuwayiyo worqqa saaxiniyaa Maachchaa Taabootaa sinttaara wottada, Xoossaa Dunkkaaniyaa geliyo magalashuwaa kaqqa.

English Sentences: And thou shalt set the altar of the burnt offering before the door of the tabernacle of the tent of the congregation.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Xuuggiyo yarshshuwaa yarshshiyoosaa Xoossaa Dunkkaaniyaa sinttaara wotta.

English Sentences: And thou shalt set the laver between the tent of the congregation and the altar, and shalt put water therein.
Wolaitta Sentences: Meechcha keriyaa Xoossaa Dunkkaaniyaappenne yarshshiyoosaappe gidduwan wottada, an haattaa tiga.

English Sentences: And thou shalt set up the court round about, and hang up the hanging at the court gate.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xoossaa Dunkkaaniyaappe kareera yuushsha aattada dabaabaa giigissa; giigissada dabaabaa geliyoosan magalashuwaa kaqqa.

English Sentences: And thou shalt take the anointing oil, and anoint the tabernacle, and all that is therein, and shalt hallow it, and all the vessels thereof: and it shall be holy.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Tiyiyo zaitiyaa ekkada, Xoossaa Dunkkaaniyaanne a giddon de7iya ubbabaa tiya; anne a giddon go7ettiyo miishsha ubbaa dummaya; yaatobare i geeshsha gidana.

English Sentences: And thou shalt anoint the altar of the burnt offering, and all his vessels, and sanctify the altar: and it shall be an altar most holy.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan xuuggiyo yarshshuwaa yarshshiyoosaanne au go7ettiyo miishsha ubbaa tiya; yarshshiyoosaa dummaya; yaatobare i ubbaappe aadhdhiya geeshsha gidana.

English Sentences: And thou shalt anoint the laver and his foot, and sanctify it.
Wolaitta Sentences: Meechcha keriyaanne a utissiyo miishshaa tiya; tiyada eta dummaya.

English Sentences: And thou shalt bring Aaron and his sons unto the door of the tabernacle of the congregation, and wash them with water.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Neeni Aaroonanne a naata Xoossaa Dunkkaaniyaa geliyo pengge ehaada, haattan eta meecca.

English Sentences: And thou shalt put upon Aaron the holy garments, and anoint him, and sanctify him; that he may minister unto me in the priest's office.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan qeesetettaa maayuwaa Aaroona maizzada, i taayyo qeesetettan oottanaadan, a tiyada dummaya.

English Sentences: And thou shalt bring his sons, and clothe them with coats:
Wolaitta Sentences: A attuma naatakka ehaada qoliyaa maizza.

English Sentences: And thou shalt anoint them, as thou didst anoint their father, that they may minister unto me in the priest's office: for their anointing shall surely be an everlasting priesthood throughout their generations.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti taayyo qeesetettan oottanaadan, eta aawaa tiyidoogaadan, etakka tiya. Eta tiyettai etakka eta sintta yeletaa ubbaa qeese oottiyaagaa" yaagiis.

English Sentences: Thus did Moses: according to all that the LORD commanded him, so did he.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin Muusee ubbabaakka GODAI bana azazidoogaadan oottiis.

English Sentences: And it came to pass in the first month in the second year, on the first day of the month, that the tabernacle was reared up.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau, Gibxxeppe eti kiyido naa77antta laittan, koiro aginaayyo koiro gallassan Xoossaa Dunkkaanee tolettiis.

English Sentences: And Moses reared up the tabernacle, and fastened his sockets, and set up the boards thereof, and put in the bars thereof, and reared up his pillars.
Wolaitta Sentences: Muusee Xoossaa Dunkkaaniyaa essiyo wode, gedeta eta sohuwan sohuwan wottiis; xagaagetanne tuussaa aattiis; hiraqotakka gelissiis.

English Sentences: And he spread abroad the tent over the tabernacle, and put the covering of the tent above upon it; as the LORD commanded Moses.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan Muusee GODAI azazidoogaadan, ha essidoogaa bollan dunkkaaniyaa toliis; he toliyaa bollan kamuwaa kammiis.

English Sentences: And he took and put the testimony into the ark, and set the staves on the ark, and put the mercy seat above upon the ark:
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaatidi tammu azazoti xaafettido masettida shuchchatu qaalaa efiidi, Taabootaa giddon wottiis; tookkiyo kasota Taabootan aattiis; atto giyo sohuwaa qum77uwaa Taabootaa bolli wottiis.

English Sentences: And he brought the ark into the tabernacle, and set up the vail of the covering, and covered the ark of the testimony; as the LORD commanded Moses.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan Taabootaa Xoossaa Dunkkaaniyaa gelissiis; genttiyo magalashuwaa kaqqidi, GODAI azazidoogaadan Maachchaa Taabootaa kammiis.

English Sentences: And he put the table in the tent of the congregation, upon the side of the tabernacle northward, without the vail.
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAI Muusa azazidoogaadan, Muusee xaraphpheezaa Xoossaa Dunkkaaniyaa gelissidi, magalashuwaappe kareera huuphessa baggaara wottiis.

English Sentences: And he set the bread in order upon it before the LORD; as the LORD had commanded Moses.
Wolaitta Sentences: Wottidi a bolli GODAA sinttan wottiyo geeshsha oittaa giigissiis.

English Sentences: And he put the candlestick in the tent of the congregation, over against the table, on the side of the tabernacle southward.
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAI Muusa azazidoogaadan, xomppiyaa wottiyo ballaa Xoossaa Dunkkaaniyaa giddo gelissidi, xaraphpheezaa hefinttaara, Xoossaa Dunkkaaniyau tohossa baggaara wottiis;

English Sentences: And he lighted the lamps before the LORD; as the LORD commanded Moses.
Wolaitta Sentences: qassi xomppeta GODAA sinttan oittiis.

English Sentences: And he put the golden altar in the tent of the congregation before the vail:
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAI azazidoogaadan, ixaanaa cuwayiyo worqqa saaxiniyaa Xoossaa Dunkkaaniyaa giddon magalashuwaa sintta baggaara wottiis;

English Sentences: And he burnt sweet incense thereon; as the LORD commanded Moses.
Wolaitta Sentences: wottidi a bolli sawiya ixaanaa cuwayiis.

English Sentences: And he set up the hanging at the door of the tabernacle.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan Xoossaa Dunkkaaniyaa penggiyan magalashuwaa woxaliis.

English Sentences: And he put the altar of burnt offering by the door of the tabernacle of the tent of the congregation, and offered upon it the burnt offering and the meat offering; as the LORD commanded Moses.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xuuggiyo yarshshuwaa yarshshiyoosaa Xoossaa Dunkkaaniyaa geliyo penggiyaa lanqqen wottiis; a bolli xuuggiyo yarshshuwaanne katta yarshshuwaa GODAI azazidoogaadan yarshshiis.

English Sentences: And he set the laver between the tent of the congregation and the altar, and put water there, to wash withal.
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAI Muusa azazidoogaadan, meechcha keriyaa Xoossaa Dunkkaaniyaappenne yarshshiyoosaappe gidduwan wottiis. Yaatidi meecettanau haattaa an tigiis.

English Sentences: And Moses and Aaron and his sons washed their hands and their feet thereat:
Wolaitta Sentences: Tigin Muusee, Aarooninne a naati bantta kushiyaanne tohuwaa an meecettoosona.

English Sentences: When they went into the tent of the congregation, and when they came near unto the altar, they washed; as the LORD commanded Moses.
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAI Muusa azazidoogaadan, eti Xoossaa Dunkkaaniyaa gelido wode woikko yarshshiyoosaakko shiiqido wode audenne meecettoosona.

English Sentences: And he reared up the court round about the tabernacle and the altar, and set up the hanging of the court gate. So Moses finished the work.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xoossaa Dunkkaaniyaanne yarshshiyoosaa yuushshi aattidi dabaabaa kessiis; he dabaabaa penggiyan magalashuwaa woxaliis. Hegaadan oottidi, Muusee oosuwaa poliis.

English Sentences: Then a cloud covered the tent of the congregation, and the glory of the LORD filled the tabernacle.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan shaarai Xoossaa Dunkkaaniyaa kammiis; GODAA bonchchoikka a kumiis.

English Sentences: And Moses was not able to enter into the tent of the congregation, because the cloud abode thereon, and the glory of the LORD filled the tabernacle.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHaarai Xoossaa Dunkkaaniyaa bolli uttido gishshaunne GODAA bonchchoi a giddon kumido gishshau, Muusee a giddo gelanau danddayibeenna.

English Sentences: And when the cloud was taken up from over the tabernacle, the children of Israel went onward in all their journeys:
Wolaitta Sentences: Israa7eelati bantta oge ubban, he shaarai Xoossaa Dunkkaaniyaappe denddiyo wode audenne a kaallidi hemetaa doommoosona.

English Sentences: But if the cloud were not taken up, then they journeyed not till the day that it was taken up.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin he shaarai denddana xayikko, i denddiyo gallassai gakkanaassi etikka qaaxxokkona.

English Sentences: For the cloud of the LORD was upon the tabernacle by day, and fire was on it by night, in the sight of all the house of Israel, throughout all their journeys.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eta oge ubban GODAA shaarai Israa7eela asai ubbai be7ishin, gallassi gallassi Xoossaa Dunkkaaniyaa kammeesinne qammi qammi qassi tamai he shaaraa bolli eexxees.
